Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y los temas educativos que dan las promotoras.
texts.en:
Rina has been a member of the communal bank "Las Kantutas" for two years in the district and province of Puno, department of Puno. She is 29 years old, single, and has no children. She finished high school and buys and sells beauty products. Rina tells us that the first loan she applied for was from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, which was for S./300.00 nuevos soles. With it she was able to grow her capital to purchase lotions, perfumes and lipsticks. She will apply for a loan of S./600.00 nuevos soles. With this, she will be able to purchase perfumes, lotions, lipsticks, mascara, etc. Her dream for the future is to open her own business of tourist restaurants. What she likes most about her communal bank is the savings and educational topics given by the promoters.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF LOTIONS, PERFUMES, LIPSTICKS, MASCARA

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ISABEL es una madre de familia, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos: Luís, tiene 13 años, estudia en el colegio y esta en el segundo grado de secundaria, Vanesa tiene siete años, estudia en colegio y esta en el segundo grado de primaria y Nicolás tiene 3 años. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia y su esposo Nicolás tienen un carro que hace servicio de transportes. Los socios al principio alquilaban un taxi de su hermana pero les parecía muy caro y entonces decidieron comprar un carro en cuotas. Ya son varios meses que hacen  el servicio de taxi y les ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para seguir pagando las cuotas de la compra del carro y continuar haciendo el servicio de taxi.   
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our partner Isabel is 36 years old, married and has three children: Luis is 13 years old, studying in the second year of junior high; Vanessa is seven, currently in the second grade; and Nicolas is 3 years old. They live in the imperial city of Cuzco. She is a member of the "MANOS JUNTAS" communal bank of the Arariwa Association. She and her husband Nicolas have a car they use for transportation service. First they rented her sister's taxi but they thought it was too expensive so they decided to buy a car in installments. It has been already several months that perform the taxi service and they have done quite well thanks to all the dedication to their work. Our partner is a working mother and an entrepreneur who carries her family forward. The partner requests the loan to keep paying for the car installments and to continue working with the taxi service. The partner is very thankful for the opportunity given to her through this means and she is committed to fulfill the corresponding payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for car financing installments and keep using the car as a taxi

loans.name: Gladys Ruth

texts.es:
La señora GLADYS RUTH D. P. D. R. tiene 52 años, vive en el distrito deL PORVENIR, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. 
Pertenece al Banco Comunal LIDERESAS EN ACCIÒN. 
La socia presenta estudios superiores D. fisioterapia y rehabilitación, es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales 3 dependen económicamente D. ella.
Gladys se dedica a la atención D. pacientes en el club D. madres y a la vez es directora D. los wawawasis D. Víctor Raúl. 
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò medicamentos e implementos para el botiquín  D. su consultorio.
Con su próximo crédito D. 1,000  nuevos soles comprarà medicamentos, gasas, algodón, mercurio , algodón, etc. para ampliar su botiquín.
Ella sueña con comprar una fotocopiadora para poder brindar el servicio D. fotocopiado y así poder obtener mayor cantidad D. dinero para continuar apoyando en la educación D. sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys Ruth D. P. D. R. is 52 years old and lives in the District of El Porvenir, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Lidresas en Acciòn” (Leaders in Action). Gladys has a degree in physiotherapy and rehabilitation. She is married and has four children of whom three are still financially dependent.

Gladys takes care of patients who are part of a parenting club and is also the Director of the Víctor Raúl Day Care Center. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased medicines and a first aid kit for her office. This next loan of 1000 soles will be used to buy medicines, gauze, cotton, mercury (Mercurochrome), and other items needed to restock her emergency supplies.

Gladys hopes to buy a photocopier so that she can proviD. duplicating services, thereby earning extra income to support the education for three of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicines, gauze, cotton, mercury, etc.

loans.name: Nueva Alternatva Group

texts.es:
María es parte D. la alcancía comunal Nueva Alternativa, viene trabajando más D. 3 años con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, donD. es participe D. las capacitaciones D. industrias alimenticias, gracias a ello ha mejorado su calidad D. vida tanto en lo material como en lo laboral.

Ella es una mujer soltera D. 50 años, trabaja desD. que acabo el colegio en la venta D. golosinas, junto dinero con lo que estudio para ser asistente D. educación inicial, luego se dedico a la venta D. comida, con el fin D. mejorar su calidad D. vida, y para ello entró a ser parte D. EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, en donD. empezó a asistir a las capacitaciones D. industrias alimenticias, es así como mejoró en la calidad D. su productos y ventas, luego en su propia casa abrió un locutorio, donD. se hacen llamadas locales, nacionales e internacionales, después gracias a unos amigos consiguió unos autos a baterías para niños los cuales los alquila para los fines D. semana.

María ha hecho planes a futuro como los D. viajar a Ayacucho y dedicarse a la crianza d Alpaca para vender su lana, y con las ganancias que ella espera obtener, comprará uno o dos puestos en un centro comercial para abrir una fuente D. soda, el más granD. sueño D. María es cumplir sus planes que ha trazado y gracias a su entusiasmo lo logrará.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Nueva Alternativa" communal bank. She has been working with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for three years, where she participates in training for the food industry. Thanks to that she has improved her quality of life in both material and work-related ways. She is a single 50 year old woman, working since she finished school in the sale of candy. She saved money with the work she did as an assistant in initial education which she studied for. She then started selling food to improve her quality of life. This is why she became a member of EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, where she started to assist in training for the food industry. This is how she improved the quality of her products, and her sales. Afterward she opened a phone booth in her home where people can make local and long distance calls. Thanks to some of her friends, she also got some small go-carts for children which she rents on the weekends. Maria has maD. future plans like traveling to Ayacucho to devote herself to the raising of Alpaca to sell their wool, and with the profit she is expecting she will buy one or two stands in a mall to open a soda fountain. Maria's greatest wish is to fulfill these plans, and thanks to her enthusiasm she will achieve them.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Biliki

texts.en:
Biliki is a hair stylist who makes a living by selling hair extensions and hair cream at retail prices in her shop. She is happy because this is the high season for her business and she hopes sales will increase. Biliki is 30 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are doing well in school. She is a LAPO client, and has applied for a loan for NGN 50,000 to buy more hair extensions and cream to sell. She is very grateful to all Kiva lenders for their interest and support.

LAPO (Lift above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and across Africa.

loans.use: To buy more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Elisa Margarita

texts.es:
La señora ELISA MARGARITA L. G. tiene 54 años, vive en el distrito deL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. 
Pertenece al Banco Comunal LIDERESAS EN ACCIÒN. 
La socia es analfabeta, refiere que es de Huamachuco y no pudo estudiar ya que desde niña se dedicò a trabajar en el campo y cuidado de niños; es madre soltera y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen económicamente de ella. 
Elisa se dedica a  la venta de leña. 
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró cajas de cuyes para criarlos y después venderlos en el mercado.
Con su próximo crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles comprarà leña al por mayor para luego venderlo en su domicilio. 
Ella sueña con empezar a criar pollos para así poder generar mayores ingresos y apoyar a sus hijas en su educación
texts.en:
Ms. Elisa Margarita L. G. is 54 years old. She lives in the district of Porvenir, providence of Trujullo, department of La Libertad - Peru. She belongs to the Community Bank Lideresas en Accion (Leaders in Action). She is illiterate. She is from Huamachuco and couldn’t study because she worked since she was a little girl in the country and caring for children. She is a single mother and has six children of which two are dependent on her. She sells firewood. With her first loan of 300.00 PEN, she purchased crates in order to breed guinea pigs and then sell them at the market. With her next loan of 500.00 PEN, she will buy firewood wholesale and then sell it from her home. She dreams of beginning to raise chicken in order to be able to generate a larger income and support her children in their education.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: will buy wholesale firewood

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 28 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a la artesanía. 
La señora Lucia estudió secundaria completa y tiene 1 hijo.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año atrás.
Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la adquisiciòn de  materiales los que emplearà en sus artesanías.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1700.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de lanas.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener su tienda de artesanías en Tacna y que su hijo sea profesional.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucia is a member of Community Bank “Manuelas de hoy II.” She lives in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 28 years old and is married. She is an artisan. Ms. Lucia finished secondary school and has one child. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan was for $175 (500 PEN) which she used to buy materials which she uses in her crafts. She is asking for a loan of $600 (1700 PEN) which she will use to buy wool. Her wish for the future is to have a craft store in Tacna and for her son to be a professional. What she likes the most about Community Bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Suyibatu

texts.en:
Suyibatu is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children. All of her children are university students. She sells bags of charcoal in her house to earn a living, and she has been in this business for 9 years. She is very determined to pull her family out of poverty. She sells for long hours to enable her to support her husband and her children in school. 

Suyibatu is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Maria Delicia

texts.es:
La señora MARIA DELICIA B. D. R. tiene 64 años, vive en el distrito D. La Esperanza , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. 
Pertenece al Banco Comunal NUEVA ESPERANZA. La socia presenta estudios hasta 3ero. D. Primaria, refiere que es D. Cajamarca y por falta D. recursos económicos sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en el campo; es conviviente y tiene 5  hijos todos mayores e independientes. 
MARIA se dedica a la confección D. ropa para damas y niñas en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles diò mantenimiento a su maquina y comprò telas para confeccionar faldas y blusas.
Con su próximo crédito D. 800.00 nuevos soles comprará telas, hilos, cierres al por mayor para la confección D. sus pedidos pendientes. 
Ella sueña con tener su tienda D. comestibles en su casa para lo cual esta ahorrando.
texts.en:
María Delicia B. D. R. is 64. She lives in the La Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Nueva Esperanza Communal Bank. She has a third graD. education. She is from Cajamarca. Because they lacked economic resources, her parents taught her to work in the fields. She is in a common law marriage, and she has five grown and independent children. She makes women’s and children’s clothes in her home. With her first loan for 300 PEN she performed maintenance on her machine and bought fabric to make skirts and blouses. With her next loan for 800 PEN she will buy fabric, needles, and zippers wholesale to make her pending orders. She dreams of having a food store in her house, and she is saving for it.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, needles, and zippers wholesale

loans.name: God Is Sufficient Group

texts.en:
Mary C. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called God is sufficient. She is 33 years old, single with 4 children aged 1-12 years old, who are in 1st-4th grade. Mary is a 4th grade drop-out due to the lack of financial support. She lives and works in the Gbartala community, about 20 kilometers  from, Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong county, Liberia.

Her business is the sales of general goods. She buys general goods wholesale and sells retail to residents of her community near Gbarnga. Mary has been running this business for 3 years, and hopes to improve the business to be a store. Mary faces high transportation costs, and getting the goods from wholesalers to her business site is a problem, because the more expense she has, the less her profit becomes. She always sells new designs of goods in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her. Mary needs this loan to purchase more new goods to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children the best education.

loans.use: To purchase more new goods to improve business.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
la sra. Rosa aminta M. F. tiene 55 años de edad, se dedica a la compra de ropa nueva de cama. tiene su negocio desde hace 3 años, su producto lo vende en empresas del Gobierno. gracias a este negocio a sacado adelante a sus hijos brindandoles estudio, alimentacion y salud. Rosa es madre soltera. ahora necesita comprar carteras de marca, este producto es muy vendido y se tienen buenas ganancias. 
su meta es poder graduar a sus hijos de la universidad para que sean unos buenos profesionales.
esta actividad es su unica fuente de igresos.
texts.en:
Rosa Aminta M. F. is 55. She buys new bedclothes. She has had the business for three years. She sells her product in government businesses. Thanks to this business she has gotten her children ahead with education, food, and health. Rosa is a single mother. She now needs a loan to buy brand name wallets. This product sells a lot, and you get good earnings. Her goal is for her children to be able to graduate from the university in order for them to become good professionals. This activity is her only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wallets and bedclothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II” desde hace 10 años del distrito y provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno; tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y  tiene 5 hijos. Ella estudiò secundaria completa y se dedica a la producción de maná.

Sonia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para poder comprar maíz, azúcar, trigo, fideos.

Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar trigo, maíz, fideos, azúcar.

Su sueño para el futuro es hacer su negocio màs grande, poner una tienda y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the "3 de Mayo II" community bank for the past 10 years from the district and province of Puno in the town of Puno. She is 40 years old, married and has 5 children. She completed secondary school and is dedicated to the production of maná. Sonia tells us that with her first requested loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos of 300 nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital to buy corn, sugar and wheat noodles. She is now requesting a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles, with which she can buy wheat, corn, noodles and sugar. Her dream for the future is to make her business larger, to have a shop and that her children are professionals. What she likes most about her community bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, wheat, sugar and rice

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad de Irama Belén Achacachi  de la Provincia Omasuyos del departamento de La Paz ubicada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Su esposo es empleado de una empresa constructora de carreteras.
  
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de  ganado de raza mejorada ( una vaca lechera) y así aumentar su producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Cecilia raises cattle. She sells her milk production to PIL Andean (Industrialized Milk Plant). She lives in the Irama Belén Achacachi community in the Omasuyos province, La Paz department. It is two and a half hours from the city of La Paz. Her husband is employed by a road construction company. The loan is to buy a better breed of livestock (a dairy cow) to increase her milk production. This will increase her income. This is her first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to improve milk production

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
La señora MARIA JULIA R. D. tiene 24 años, vive en el distrito deL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LIDERESAS EN ACCIÒN. 
La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundaria, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 1 año y 7 meses de edad quien depende económicamente de ella, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo económico del padre.
María se dedica a  la compra, venta y alquiler de películas en su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró CDS al por mayor.
Con su próximo crédito de 400.00 nuevos soles viajarà a Lima a comprar CDS, DVDS, VCDS para venderlos y alquilarlos.
María sueña con alquilar un local en un centro comercial en donde pueda vender sus CDS, DVDS y VCDS con mayor rapidez y así obtener mayor ganancia para poder facilitarle a su hija todo lo que necesite.
texts.en:
Mrs. MARIA JULIA R. D. is 24 years old and lives in the PORVENIR district in the Trujillo province in the La Libertad department of Peru. She belongs to the LIDERESAS EN ACCION Village Bank. She has a secondary level education and is a single mom with a daughter who is one year and seven months old. Her daughter depends on her mother entirely for financial support as the father does not contribute. María is in sales - selling and renting movies from her home. With her first loan of 300.00 soles, she bought CDs wholesale. With her next loan of 400.00 soles, she will go to Lima to buy CDs, DVDs and Video CDs to sell and rent. María hopes to rent a booth in the market where she can sell her CDs, DVDs and Video CDs more quickly and generate more income to provide her daughter with everything that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of CDs, DVDs and Video CDs

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin sells frozen foods at retail prices to her customers. She has 2 deep freezers that she uses to store her frozen foods. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She has been in this business for 6 years. The demand for her frozen foods is high. She hopes to own a poultry farm in the future.

Toyin is 44 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more frozen food to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamin es chofer propietario de minibús trabaja como transportista interprovincial La Paz – Tiquina; la esposa trabaja como empleada domestica y  así generan sus ingresos con que cubren la manutención de su familia. Vive en casa alquilada ubicado en  la Zona Villa Bolivar D de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinara a la reparación de su herramienta de trabajo (minibus) para poder continuar prestando servicio de transporte publico.
 
Es segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Benjamin is the driver-owner of a minibus and works as an interprovincial carrier between La Paz and Tiquina. His wife works as a housekeeper and thus they generate the income with which they cover the family expenses. He lives in a rented house which is located in Villa Bolivar Zone D in the city of El Alto.

The loan is intended for the repair of his work tool (minibus) in order to continue being able to offer public transit service.

This is his second loan with IMPRO. Good payment history allows him to apply for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance and repair of his minibus.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del  Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 20 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado. 

La señora Margarita, tiene grado de instrucción secundaria completa y no tiene hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ganado.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de un toro.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener su capital propio y una casa en Ilave.

Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the “3 de Mayo” community bank. She lives in the Llave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 20 years old and is married. She buys and sells livestock. Margarita has completed secondary school. She does not have children. She has been a member of the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years; her first loan from the community bank was for $175, and she used it to buy livestock. This loan is for $525, which she will use to buy a bull. Her dream for the future is to have her own capital and her own house. What she likes best about the Community Bank is saving.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bull

loans.name: Daakubulee Group

texts.en:
Lorpu Tokpah is a leader of a group of 4 borrowers, called Daakubulee. She is single with 2 children, aged 8 and 10 years old, who are in kindergarten and 1st grade. Lorpu is an illiterate due to the lack of financial support. She lives and works in the Belefania community, Gbarnga city, the capital of Bong county, Liberia.

Her business is the sale of prepared food. She cooks food that is sold per plate to residents of her community in Gbarnga. Lorpu has been running this business for 3 years, and hopes to improve her business. Lorpu faces problems with the long distance required to get materials to prepare the food to serve to her clients. Her food is always tasty and clean, in order to encourage customers to continue buying her food. Lorpu needs this loan to purchase more materials for cooking. She dreams of giving her family the best help she can to improve their lives.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for cooking.

loans.name: Gusman

texts.es:
Gusman es chofer asalariado en el grupo de trufis 88 del Sindicato Eduardo Abaroa; trabaja dos años en el mencionado sindicato.
 
Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la zona Pazanqueri  Provincia murillo de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Su esposa le colabora con el cuidado de su hogar y de su hijo el cual esta en etapa escolar.

  El crédito lo destinará para compra de material de construcción, por que hará construir una habitación donde vivirá con su familia.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Gusman is a salaried driver for the shared commuter cars called Group 88, with the Eduardo Abaroa Syndicate. He has worked for this syndicate for two years. He lives in his parents house located in the Pazanqueri Provincia Murillo area in the city of La Paz. His wife helps with the upkeep of the home and their son who is school age. The loan will be designated for the purchase of construction materials for a room to be built where he will live with his family. This first loan with field partner Impro, with this completed evaluation they qualified for the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, stucco and other materials in order to build a room.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
el sr. Angel A. G. tiene 56 años de edad, tiene mas de 10 años de dedicarse a la fabricacion de ladrillos para piso y bloques, antes trabajaba en sociedad con otra persona pero debido a bajas en el negocio decidieron vender las maquinas para elaborar los ladrillos, Angel decidio comprarle las maquinas y hacer solo su negocio, instalo su fabrica en su casa de habitacion en la colonia Sagastume, ahi tiene tres trabajadores y le estan saliendo las cosas bien.
con las ganancias de este negocio cubre con todos los gastos del hogar.
necesita el credito para comprar cemento, arena, colorante y piedras para tener una mayor produccion.
texts.en:
Angel A. G., 56, has been a brick and tile manufacturer for over 10 years. He used to work with a partner but, due to declines in business, they decided to sell the brick-making machines. Angel decided to buy the machines and go into business for himself. He installed the factory in his home in the Sagustume neighborhood. He hired three laborers and things are working out well. With his profits he covers household expenses. He needs funding to buy cement, sand, dye and stones in order to increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, sand and stone.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Maribel pertenece a Banco Comunal Colón que se reúne en la parroquia del mismo nombre, nos tomó 20 minutos en llegar desde la ciudad de Portoviejo, Colon es un bello lugar lleno de cultivos una zona muy productiva, sus moradores tienes diversos negocios y unos viajan a trabajar hasta la ciudad.

Maribel se inició en la Fundación Espoir cuando se rumoró que iban a formar un banquito ella decidió unirse para poder incrementar su negocio, fue por medio de sus amigas.

Maribel esta casada tiene tres hijos el esposo es trabajador publico en la ciudad de Portoviejo, ella se dedica por entero a sus negocio que es la venta de sabanas, edredones, cobertores y cobijas, todos los días ella sale a trabajar recorre el sector a pie vendiendo de puerta en puerta, ya cuenta con sus  clientes fijos que le entrega dándole facilidades de pago, cuenta doña Maribel que este negocio lo ha sabido llevar a delante que en este año y medio que lo tiene le ha ayudado mucho para sostener su familia con las ganancias que obtiene y lo mas importante es que ha podido incrementar su negocio.

Maribel dos veces la mes tiene que viajar hasta la sierra lugar donde ella hace las compras de sus pedidos al por mayor en los distribuidores no le importa el sacrificio que hace porque es bien recompensado porque este negocio le deja mitad por  mitad de las ganancias, hasta la actualidad no ha tenido ningún inconveniente con sus clientes, el crédito que esta solicitando lo invertirá todo en comprar mas mercadería porque para este mes ya tiene varios pedidos, estima que todo le vaya bien y cerrar este año con buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Señora Maribel belongs to the group Colón that meets at a church with the same name. It took us 20 minutes to reach Portoviejo. Colón is a beautiful place with many crops. It is a very productive zone with diverse businesses though some travel to the city to work.

Maribel started with Fundacion Espoir when it was rumored that a village bank was forming. She decided to join so she could improve her business and it was because of her friends.

Maribel is married with three children. Her husband is a public employee for the city of Portoviejo. She sells sheets, duvets and blankets. Everyday she leaves for work, selling her items door to door. She counts on her regular customers in giving her easy payments. Doña Maribel says that this business has helped her move ahead and in the last year and a half, her income has helped a lot in supporting her family. The most important thing is that she could increase her income.

Two times a month Maribel has to travel to the mountains where she picks up her orders from the distributors. It doesn’t matter the sacrifice that she makes as she is well compensated. This business gives her 25% profit of total sales. Currently she hasn’t had any problems with her customers. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise because this month she has had various orders. She is esteemed that everything will go well and finish the year with good profits.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets, duvets and blankets

loans.name: Vanesa Rosario

texts.es:
La señora VANESA ROSARIO R. T. tiene 25 años, vive en el distrito deL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LIDERESAS EN ACCION. 
La socia presenta estudios hasta 6to. de Primaria y refiere que por falta de recursos económicos dejò de estudiar para empezar a trabajar; es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo quien depende economicamente de ella y se encuentra embarazada de 5 meses.
Vanesa  se dedica a  la venta de menús en su casa. 
Èste es su primer crèdito de 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizarà para copmprar arroz, azùcar, aceite, fideos, papas , mesas y bancos.
Ella sueña con ampliar cada vez màs su negocio y empezar con la venta de cenas por las noches.
texts.en:
Vanesa Rosario R. T. is 25. She lives in the Porvenir district, Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the "Lideresas en Acción" Community Bank. Vanesa completed 6th grade but had to leave school and start work due to economic difficulties. She lives with her partner and has one child; she is five months pregnant. Vanesa sells cooked meals from her home. This is her first loan, for $125, and she will use it to buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles and potatoes, as well as tables and benches. She dreams of steadily expanding her business and beginning to serve dinners in the evening.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, potatoes, and tables and benches.

loans.name: Mariuxi Del Rocio

texts.es:
En el Banco Comunal Colón se reúne en la parroquia Colón perteneciente a la ciudad de Portoviejo, en este banco pudimos conversar con la señora 

Casada desde hace 14 años, tiene tres hijos ella nació en Colón, hace 5 años empezó con las ventas de Yanbal (Cosméticos vendidos por catalogo), a la señora Mariuxi siempre le han gustado los negocios antes ella tenia las ventas de artículos del hogar pero se le presentó la oportunidad de empezar algo nuevo y la hermana le ayuda a que ingrese en las ventas de los productos de Yanbal aprendió del negocio y después ella se puso lo propio continuando con las ventas de estos productos.

Todos los meses hace los pedidos según lo que los clientes deseen hay veces que tiene que invertir hasta 500  dólares en pedidos, ya tiene sus clientes fijos que son muy responsables  para esta época del año es cuando más vende.

Mariuxi es una mujer muy trabajadora no descansa con este préstamo que va a recibir de la fundación, invertirá en gran parte para los productos y la otra parte en el negocio de los boyo (Plátano verde con maní y carne) que es un plato típico de la zona de Manabí, ella junto a la tía del esposo ya tiene algún tiempo trabajando en la preparación de este delicioso plato, tiene sus pedidos que han llegado hasta preparar 1300 bollos en una semana, y es una manera de ayudarse con esta venta.
texts.en:
The communal group Colón meets in a church named Colon located in Portoviejo. It was here we could talk with the client.

She has been married for 14 years and has three children. She was born in Colón and 5 years ago started selling Yanbal cosmetics from a catalog. Señora Mariuxi always has liked this business. Before she sold household items. The opportunity presented itself to start something new and with the help of her sister, she started selling Yanbal products. She learned this business and after started selling these products alone.

Every month there are times when she must invest up to $500 in orders. Already she has regular clients who are very dependable in this part of the year with the most sales.

Mariuxi is a very hard working woman who won’t rest with this loan she is going to receive from the Foundacion. She is going to invest most of it in products and the other part in her boyo business (green bananas with noodles and beef) which is a typical dish from the Manabí zone. She, together with the aunt of her husband, have been working making this delicious dish for some time now. Her orders have reached 1300 bollos a week and this loan will help with these sales.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes, lip sticks and Yambal products

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
La señorita Lizbeth es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Candelaria” desde hace 2 años, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno; tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella tiene estudios superiores completos y tiene un consultorio unique.

Lizbeth nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para poder comprar productos de belleza.

Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1000.00 con el cual podrá comprar más mercadería como perfumes, labiales, cremas, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es crecer en su trabajo y poder conseguir un buen trabajo en su profesión.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Lizbeth has been a member of the “Virgen de la Candelaria” communal bank for two years. She lives in the Ilave district, El Collao province, and department of Puno. She is 28 years old and is single with no children. She has completed school and has a business selling the Unique brand of beauty products.

Lizbeth’s first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for 500 soles, which allowed her to increase her working capital and purchase beauty products. This loan, for 1000 soles, will be used to purchase more merchandise, such as perfumes, lipsticks, creams, etc.

Her dream for the future is to grow her business and be able to get a good job in her profession. What she likes most about her communal bank is the savings accounts.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, lipsticks, creams, etc.

loans.name: Matilde De Los Dolores

texts.es:
En el BANCO COMUNAL Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo, nos encontramos con este banco muy unido, y tuvimos la oportunidad que la señora Matilde nos cuente algo de su vida, en sus miradas pudimos ver la tristeza que le embarga por la pérdida de su esposo que hace seis meses falleció, junto a el tenia trabajaban en su propio negocio como es la venta de comida rápida.

Matilde tiene 63 años, con su esposo procrearon 6 hijos, ahora ellos son su fuerza en estos momentos de dolor, nos cuenta Matilde que lleva 15 años en la ardua labor de preparar comida rápida, no tuvo la necesidad de salir de casa para poder hacerlo, cuando estaba en vida su esposo le arreglo la parte frontal de la casa para poder improvisar  su negocio, empezaron con un horno a carbón y unas cuantas mesas y sillas , de jueves a domingo desde las 5 de la tarde hasta las 8 de la noche atiende a su clientela junto a su hija, es ella la que la acompaña ahora en casa.

Matilde con el préstamo que recibirá invertirá en su negocio, va a surtirlo de colas, cervezas y carnes, para esta manabita no ha sido nada fácil mantener este negocio, ha pensado en cambiar de trabajo puesto que en los actuales momentos está un poco delicada de salud el doctor le aconseja que deje esta venta porque le humo le esta causando problemas en su garganta, pero ella no va a dejar de trabajar ya esta pensando en dedicarse hacer empanadas, morcillas y platos típicos.
texts.en:
In the communal bank Colon in Portoviejo, we found this very united group and we had the opportunity to talk with Matilde who told us a bit about her life. In her eyes we could see the sadness left by the loss of her husband who passed away 6 months ago. Together they had worked in their own fast food restaurant.

Matilde is 63 years old and with her husband, had 6 children. Right now they are her strength in this moment of sadness. Matilde told us that she had been making fast food for 15 years and she didn’t have to leave the house to do it. When her husband was alive, he fixed the front of their house so she could sell food from it. They started with a charcol grill and a few tables and chairs, from Thursday to Sunday, 5 in the afternoon until 8 in the evening attending to customers together with her daughther. Her daughter is still accompanying her in the house.

With the loan that Matilde is going to receive, she is going to invest in her business. She is going to stock up on sodas, beers and beef. It hasn’t been easy to maintain this business. She had thought of changing her business because there were times when her health was delicate and the doctor advised her to leave this business because the smoke was causing problems with her throat. Still, she is not going to leave this work and is thinking to start making empanadas, mocillas and typical dishes.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on sodas, beers and beef

loans.name: Nolvia Damaris

texts.es:
la sra. Nolvia Damaris V. tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la colonia La Esperanza de la ciudad capital, tiene una tienda de ropa usada la cual esta ubicada en el mercado los Dolores, tiene 2 años de tener su tienda en dicho lugar. ahora la ropa la compra clasificada a $1.50 por pieza, pero le sale caro estar comprando a este precio y desea comprarla por fardos que sale mas barata. con las ganancias que tiene le ayuda a su esposo para el suento de su hogar. su esposo se dedica al mecanica.
desea comprar el fardo de ropa para tener bastante ropa para la epoca de navidad.
Nolvia tiene una hija pequeña.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nolvia Damaris V. is 35 years old and lives in the La Esperanza colony of the capital city. She has a used clothing store that is located in the Los Dolores market. She has had the store in this location for two years.

Right now she buys the clothes for $1.50 for each piece but it becomes expensive buy at this price and she wants to buy in bundles, which will come out much cheaper.

With the earnings she has, she helps her husband with their home maintenance. Her husband is a mechanic.

She wants to buy the bundle of clothing in order to have enough for the Christmas season.

Noliva has a small daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dedicacion

texts.es:
Nuestra socia DEDICACION es una madre de familia, tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene tres hijos. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la  atención de su negocio de venta de repuestos en el distrito de San Sebastián. Ya son diez años con el negocio le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio desea comprar más repuestos como empaquetaduras, pistones y fajas.    
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
DEDICACION, 35, lives with her life partner and their three children in the imperial city of Cusco. She is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN” communal bank. She alternates her domestic chores with her replacement parts sales business in the San Sebastián district. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She is a hard-working, enterprising mother who struggles to get her family ahead in life. She needs funding to buy parts like gaskets, pistons and belts. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicle repair parts like gaskets, pistons, belts.

loans.name: Geyssel Carolina

texts.es: Geyssel Carolina tiene la edad de 22 años, ella tiene 1 hijo y actualmente estudia pues esta a su cargo. La ubicación del negocio de es el mercado. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que tiene de poseer este negocio, ya que surgió porque le gusta trabajar fuertemente y es así como decide vender estos productos. Los propósitos de ella son de invertir en suficientes productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para aplicarlo al capital de trabajo y así efectuar la compra de golosinas, pan, gaseosa y jugos. Sus sueños son de establecer una pulpería en su vivienda ya que la posee actualmente es en el mercado central.
texts.en:
Geyssel Carolina is 22-years-old and has one dependent child who is currently going to school. She works at a small grocery store which is located in a market. She has had this business for more than three years and she started it because she likes to work hard and so she decided to sell these products. Her goals are to invest in enough products to satisfy her customers' demand. The loan she has requested will be used for working capital and to allow her to purchase candy, bread, soft drinks, and juices. She dreams of starting a small grocery store in her home since her current one is owned by the central market.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy candy, bread, soft drinks, and juices

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora DORIS ELIZABETH F. A., tiene  31 años, vive en el distrito de BUENOS AIRES provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios superiores incompletos, refiere que por problemas económicos dejò los estudios y se dedicò a trabajar; tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella porque es madre soltera. La socia se dedica  a la venta de menús y pollos a la brasa en su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles  comprò: arroz, papas, pollo, fideos, aceite, carnes, huevos, etc. para la preparación de sus menús.
Con su próximo crédito de 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará platos, cubiertos, vasos, sacos de papa al por mayor y un horno pequeño para la preparación de los pollos a la brasa.
Ella sueña con remodelar y ampliar su local.
texts.en:
Señora Doris Elizabeth F. A. is 31 years old and lives in the Buenos Aires district in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad--Peru. The member belongs to the community bank “Mujeres Emprenedoras II.” She has not completed her studies because economic problems forced her to stop her studies and to start working. She has three children who depend on her economically as she is a single mother. The member sells prepared meals and roasted chicken out of her home. With her first loan of 300.00 Nuevos Soles she bought rice, potatoes, chicken, noodles, oil, meats, eggs, etc. for the preparation of her meals. With the next loan of 1700 Nuevos Soles she will buy plates, silverware, glasses, sacks of potatoes in bulk and a small oven to prepare her roasted chicken. She dreams of remodeling and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plates, silverware, glasses, potatoes in bulk and a small oven for roasting chicken.

loans.name: Noris Narcisa

texts.es:
En la Parroquia de Colón en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen las señoras del Banco Comunal Colón, se reúnen los lunes y es un gran grupo muy unido, este es uno de los sectores más poblado de la urbe portovejense. Muchos de los habitantes se dedican a los sembríos, y a criar aves.

La señora Noris está casada tiene dos hijos, el esposo tiene como profesión chofer, y ella es maestra de escuela, pero se ayuda con las ventas de productos  YANBAL, ya tiene 3 años con estas ventas y le va muy bien, cuenta que por medio de una amiga ella se integro a la fundación Espoir y con los prestamos ella ha podido incrementar sus ventas, empezó con 100 dólares como capital, Nory ya tiene sus clientes fijos que son sus amigas y compañeras de trabajo y su familia, el esposo le ayuda mucho  ya que en el taxi ella recorre sus ventas, durante estos años que ya lleva vendiendo Yanbal la señora Noris se siente bien con este negocio que no ha pensado cambiarlo, eso la motiva para continuar formando parte de la Fundación y obtener más préstamos para surtir su negocio, los productos de mayor venta son los de caballeros, como los perfumes que son los que más vende.

Con el préstamo que está solicitando Nory invertirá en más productos porque en esta época de navidad tiene muchos pedidos, espera poder cumplir uno  de sus sueños que es poder tener su bazar con vitrinas en la casa, ella está reuniendo dinero para logarlo.
texts.en:
In the Colón Parish in the city of Portoviejo, the women of the Colón Communal Bank meet. They meet on Mondays and they make up a very close-knit group. They live in one of the most populated areas of this major city.

Mrs. Noris is married with two children. Her husband works as a driver and she is a school teacher but she also helps by selling Yanbal beauty products. She has been selling for three years and the sales have gone very well. She notes that it was through a friend that she joined the ESPOIR Foundation and with the loans she has received she has been able to increase her sales. She began with $100 as working capital. Now she has regular customers that are her friends, coworkers, and family. Her husband helps a lot as she can use his taxi for her sales. Throughout all the years she has been selling Yanbal products, Mrs. Noris feels good about her business and has not thought about changing it. She is motivated to stay part of the ESPOIR Foundation and to receive more loans to supply for her business. Her most popular products include those for gentleman such as perfumes that are in high demand.

With the loan she has requested, Noris will invest in more products because as it is Christmastime she has many orders. She hopes to be able to accomplish her dream of being able to have her store with a shop window at her house. She is saving money to be able to do this.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes, cosmetics, and general Yanbal products

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
La señora Nely es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” desde hace 16 meses, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno.
Tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Ella estudiò hasta primaria completa; se dedica a llamadas múltiples de celulares.

Nely nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 700.00 con el cual podrá comprar más mercadería(celulares).

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Ilave.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Señora Nely has been a member of the communal bank "3 de Mayo" for 16 months. It is located in the Llave district in El Collao province in the Puno region. She is 27 years old, married, and has 3 children. She completed her primary studies; she has a cellular telephone call center where she sells phone calls. Nely tells us that with the first loan she obtained through the Manuela Ramos organization of 500 nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital. She now requests a loan of 700 nuevos soles which will be used to buy more merchandise (cellular phones.) Her dream is to have her own house in Llave. She enjoys accumulating savings in her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cellular phone equipment

loans.name: The Fighters Of Masisea Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “Las Luchadoras de Masisea” tiene cuatro meses de haberse formado, son del distrito de Masisea, región de Ucayali, esta conformado por 16 socias, todas mujeres emprendedoras y muy trabajadoras, con el anhelo de superarse cada día, que su economía crezca con el transcurrir del tiempo y ser mujeres con mucha capacidad de desarrollarse laboralmente.
Ellas requieren un préstamo de 7,000 soles, para seguir dedicándose a diferentes actividades como son: venta de comidas típicas, lencería , confecciones, abarrotes, juguería, verduras y venta de gaseosas. Milusca es L. presidenta de este Banco Comunal, elL. es una mujer activa y colaboradora, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos, uno de ellos mayor de edad. Milusca se dedica a L. venta de comida durante el día, esta actividad L. realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, él es agricultor, el primer crédito que recibió Milusca fue de 300 soles, que lo utilizó en L. compra de productos para su negocio. L.  meta de Milusca, como de las demás socias, es poder crecer en su negocio y seguir apoyando en los gastos económicos del hogar.
texts.en:
The Community Bank “The Fighters of Masisea” was formed four months ago. It is made up of 16 members from the district of Masisea in the Ucayali region of Peru. All of these women are enterprising and hard-working. They hope to do better each day, to see their finances grow over time, and to be women with a great capacity for developing work skills. They need a loan of 7000 soles in order to continue working in various jobs, such as the sale of regional foods, linen goods, groceries, vegetables, sodas and juices, and dressmaking. Milusca is the president of the Community Bank. She is an active and contributing woman who is 44 years old. She is the mother of two sons, one of them an adult. Milusca sells food during the day, working from her house. She has the support of her husband, who is a farmer. The first loan that Milusca received was for 300 soles, which she used to buy products for her business. Milusca’s goal, like those of the rest of the members of the bank, is to be able to grow in her business and continue to help with the expenses in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They will use the loan to continue working in various jobs, such as the sale of regional foods, linen goods, groceries, vegetables, sodas and juices, and dressmaking.

loans.name: Isaac Zamir

texts.es:
el joven Isaac Zamir T. R. tiene 21 años de edad, es un pequeño comerciante que comenzo vendiendo productos en la colonia donde el vive, luego vendia en un colegio, con el pasar del tiempo logro conseguir un local para montar su tienda, este negocio esta ubicado en el mercado los Dolores.
Isaac es una persona joven y esta soltero, las gancias las utiliza para invertirlas en su negocio y la otra parte para comprar productos de uso personal. parte de las ganancias las utiliza para sus estudios, esta estudiando Contaduria Publica.
texts.en:
Isaac Zamir T. R. is a 21-year-old shopkeeper who began selling products in the neighborhood where he lives. Next he started selling them at his school, and with time he managed to obtain a place to set up a store. His business is now located in the Dolores Market.

Isaac is young and single. He will use part of his earnings to invest in his business and part to buy products for personal use. He will also use part to finance his studies. He is studying Certified Public Accounting (CPA).

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soap, bleach, floor cleaner, cakes, beans, rice, sugar, lard, oil, corn and wheat flour, cups, plates, disposable forks, pasta, and salsa

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Women Shareholders Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “Las mujeres Accionistas” está formado por un grupo D. 9 mujeres dinámicas y perseverantes, la mayoría viven en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, la presidenta Celia López Moreira es madre D. dos hijos menores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida y repuestos. Las socias que forman este Banco Comunal trabajan en diferentes labores como; venta D. pescado, abarrotes, carnes, frutas, golosinas, verduras, bebidas, etc. Este Banco forma parte del Movimiento Manuela Ramos/Credi-mujer desD. hace cuatro meses, donD. siempre han demostrado ser unas socias puntuales y colaboradoras. En la actualidad este Banco necesita un crédito D. 3500 soles que será utilizado en los diferentes negocios en las que ellas se desempeñan. Este grupo está agradecido por la confianza que depositaron en ellas, porque gracias a los préstamos ellas pueden utilizar su crédito en los negocios que cada una tiene, D. esta manera ellas pueden progresar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Mujeres Accionistas" [Women Shareholders] is a group of 9 dynamic and persevering women. Most of them live in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. Their president, Celia López Moreira, is the mother of two minors and has a business that sells food and spare parts. The partners of this communal bank work in different areas such as the sale of fish, groceries, meat, fruits, sweets, vegetables, drinks, etc. This bank has been a part of the Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER Movement for the past four months, and its members have proven to be punctual and collaborative. Currently this bank needs a loan for 3,500 soles, which will be applied to the different businesses the partners manage. This group is grateful for the trust placed on them. Thanks to the loans they can use their credit in the businesses that each of them owns and in this way they can progress and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for the different businesses owned by the members: fish, groceries, meat, fruits, sweet, and drinks.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La señora Anastacia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 45 años de edad y es conviviente.Estudiò primaria completa y tiene 6 hijos.  
Se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de cereales.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.800.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de cereales de la región.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener una casa en Arequipa.

Lo que màs le gusta de su organización son las reuniones.
texts.en:
Anastacia is a member of the Communal Bank “Manuelas de hoy II." She lives in the Ilave district of the El Collao province in the Puno region. She is 45 years old and lives with her partner. She completed primary school and has 6 children. She buys and sells cereals.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 3 years. Her first Communal Bank loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and was used to purchase cereals.

She is requesting a loan of 800 Peruvian soles that will be used to purchase cereals from the region.

She hopes to someday have a house in Arequipa. Her favorite part of the organization is the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bulk foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more materials like nails, saws, and sandpaper

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La Sra. Felicitas tiene 45 años de edad ,es casada, madre de 8 hijos (5 varones y 3 mujeres; el mayor tiene 20 años de edad y el menor tiene 8 años de edad), estudió solo el primer año de primaria, actualmente vive en el Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno.
Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret”.
Con su primer crédito de s/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró papa; el negocio al que se dedica en la actualidad es la compra y venta de ovinos y alpacas.
Para incrementar su capital solicitará un nuevo crédito de 700.00 nuevos soles  para comprar 4 ovinos y 2 alpacas.
Su sueño es tener su granja de gallinas ponedoras con manejo técnico.
Doña Felicitas nos manifiesta que desde que se integró el Banco Comunal empezó hacer negocio hasta la fecha y que también le gusta ahorrar en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Sra. Felicitas is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 8 children (5 sons and 3 daughters) ranging in age from 8 to 20 years of age. She has a first grade education and currently lives in the District of Illave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno.

Felicitas is one of the founding members of the Jesus of Nazareth Communal Bank. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought potatoes. She currently buys and sells sheep and alpacas. To increase her capital, she is requesting a new loan of 700 soles to purchase 4 sheep and 2 alpacas. Her dream is to have a poultry farm and have technical support.

Doña Felicitas tells us that she started her business when she first joined the Communal Bank. She also enjoys the savings account her Communal Bank offers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 4 sheep and 2 alpacas

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara R. es una socia trabajadora y dinámica, vive en el distrito D. Callerìa, región D. Ucayali; tiene 45 años, madre D. 2 hijos mayores D. edad.
Clara se dedica a la venta D. zapatos y sàbanas; cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo el que trabaja en un aserradero. 
Clara forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el fin” desD. hace tres años. 
El primer préstamo que recibió fuè D. 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizò en la compra D. productos para la venta D. comida. 
Ahora necesita un préstamo D. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, una parte será para invertirlo en zapatos, y la otra parte en madera para el arreglo D. su casa. 
La meta D. Clara es tener un restaurant con variedad en platos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Clara R. is one of our hardworking and dynamic members. She lives in the District of Callerìa, Ucayali region. She is 45 years old and the mother of 2 adult children. Clara sells shoes and bed sheets. She has the support of her husband, who works in a sawmill. Three years ago, she joined the Communal Bank “Juntas hasta el Fin” (Together until the End). The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to buy ingredients for selling prepared meals. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles. Part of the loan will be used to buy shoes. The remainder will be used to buy wood for remodeling her house. Clara’s goal is to have a restaurant where she can offer a variety of dishes to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes to sell & wood for remodeling her home

loans.name: Giovani

texts.es:
Giovani  es una socia  emprendedora y muy dinámica; vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años, madre de 2 hijos adolescentes y se dedica a la venta de ladrillos al por mayor y menor; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en una fàbrica de ladrillos.
Siente que su negocio ha mejorado ya que sus ventas son mayores.
Giovany es una de las integrantes del Banco Comunal “Las Lomas de Yarina” desde hace siete años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuewos soles, que le permitieron invertir en la compra de polos para vender a sus conocidos. 
Ahora Giovanni necesita un crédito de 3,000.00 soles, que serán utilizados para comprar seis millares de ladrillos para vender. 
La meta de Giovany es tener una tienda de prendas de vestir y accesoR. para damas.
texts.en:
Giovani is one our enterprising and dynamic members. She lives in the District of Yarina Cocha, Ucayali region. Giovani is 33 years old and the mother of two teenage children.

She sells bricks wholesale and retail. Giovani has the support of her husband, who works at a brick factory. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Lomas de Yarina” for seven years. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles, which allowed her to purchase polo shirts to sell to acquaintances. Giovani is now requesting a loan of 3000 soles to purchase 6000 bricks to sell.

Her goal is open a store where she can sell women’s clothing and accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 6000 bricks to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II” desde hace 10 años del distrito y provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno. Tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y  tiene 7 hijos. Ella estudiò secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de  animales menores.

María nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela R. que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para poder comprar ovejas.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar ganado porcino, ovino.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su granja de conejos y gallinas.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Ten years ago, Sra. Maria joined the Communal Bank “3 de Mayo II”, which is located in the District and Province of Puno, Department of Puno. She is 36 years old, married, and has 7 children. Maria has a high school education and engages in the purchase and sale of small animals.

Maria says the first loan she requested from Manuela R. was in the amount of 300 soles, which increased her capital for buying sheep. She is now asking for a new loan of 1500 soles to buy pigs and sheep. Her dream for the future is to have a farm where she can raise rabbits and chickens.

What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the savings and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep & pigs

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de  de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 30 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores como: ovino y porcino.
La señora Luz estudiò secundaria completa y tiene 4 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fuè de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de animales.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra de un toro.

Su deseo para el futuro es comprar una casa en Tacna y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Lo que màs le gusta de su organización es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz is a member of the communal bank "24 of June", she lives in the district de Ilave, El Collao province in the Puno department. She is 30 years old and married. She works selling and buying smaller animals like sheep and pigs. Mrs. Luz completed high school and has 4 children. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years now, and in her communal bank her first loan was for S/.500.00 nuevos soles, which she used to buy animals. She will request a loan for S/. 1,5000.00 nuevos soles which she will invest in buying a bull. Her hope for the future is to buy a house in Tacna and that her children become professional. What she likes the best about her organization is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a bull

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
La señorita Mary  es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 22 años de edad,es soltera, no tiene hijos y siguiò estudios superiores completos. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado como ovejas.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 meses atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fuè de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de animales menores.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.500.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de animales como: oveja y porcino.

Su deseo para el futuro es abrir una tienda de computadoras y tener trabajo propio.

Lo que màs le gusta de su organización son las reuniones que se dan.
texts.en:
Miss Mary is a member of the Communal Bank "24 of June", she lives in the district of Ilave, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 22 years old, single, has no children, and continued to study college. She works buying and selling livestock such as sheep. She has been working wih the Movimieno Manuela Ramos for 6 months now, and in her communal bank her first loan was for S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, which she used to buy small animals. She is requesting a loan for S/. 500.00 nuevos soles which she will invest in buying animals such as sheep and pigs. Her hope for the future is to open a computer store and to have her own job. What she likes the best about her organization is the gatherings they organize.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying sheep and pigs

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Nimia P. es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 45 años, madre de 4 hijos mayores de edad.
Nimia se dedica a la preparación de néctar de frutas, actividad que realiza en su casa; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es comerciante independiente. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desde hace seis años y el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que utilizó en la compra de golosinas para vender desde su casa. Ahora Nimia necesita un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados para la compra de frutas e insumos para producción de néctar de cocona. 
La meta de Nimia es tener un local propio y poner una jugueria.
texts.en:
Nimia P. is a hardworking and active member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 45 years old and mother to 4 adult children. Nimia works preparing fruit juice, an activity she carries out in her home; she can count with the support of her husband who is an independent merchant. She has been part of the communal bank "Juntas hasta el final" (together to the end) for six years, and the first loan she received was for 300.00 nuevos soles, which she used to buy candy to sell out of her house. Now Nimia needs a loan for 800.00 nuevos soles which will be used to buy fruits and materials to produce the juice in her kitchen. Nimia's goal is to have her own premises to open a juice bar.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying fruits and materials to prepare her juices

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Leonor es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y no realizò estudios. Se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fuè de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de cereales.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.2000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que invertirá en la compra  de cereales de la región: papa, chuño, habas, etc.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener su tienda de cereales.

Lo que màs le gusta de su organización es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Ms.Leonor is a member of the Communal Bank "Manuelas de hoy II" [Today's Manuelas II]. She lives in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 52 years old, she is married and has three children. She never studied. She buys and sells staple foods.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the past year. In her Communal Bank, her first loan was S./300.00 which she used to purchase staple foods.

She asks for a loan of S/.2000.00 which she will invest in the purchase of local staple foods: potatoes, freeze-dried potatoes, beans, etc.

Her wish for the future is to have her own staple foods store.

What she likes the most about her organization is the saving process and the meetings with members.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of barley, beans, chuño, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fertilizer and soil amendments

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
la sra. Karla Patricia F. R. tiene 37 años de edad, tiene una pulperia la cual esta ubicada en el barrio El Chile. es casada, con las ganancias que le genera su negocio logra cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar, le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos economicos.
tiene 6 años de tener su tienda.
necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia para surtir su negocio.
su meta es terminar de construir su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia F. R. is 37. She has a mini market, which is located in the El Chile neighborhood. She is married. With the earnings generated by her business she is able to cover all of the household expenses, and she helps her husband with other expenses. She has had her store for six years. She needs the loan to buy more merchandise to stock her business. Her goal is to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to stock her mini market

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fertilizer and yams

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Virgen del Carmen (which is the name of a saint of Peru), are clients of Asociación Arariwa.  This communal bank consists of 12 members in Cusco. All the group members live in Cusco. Some of the members are single, while some are married, or live with their common law spouse and have children. The members of Virgen del Carmen are involved in various commercial activities including selling clothing. One of the members is a seamstress and waiter.  

One of the members, Edith, was born in Cusco, and lives in Santa Ana, a neighborhood of Cusco. She is 39 years old and married with 2 children. She works as a teacher and also operates a bookstore on Calle Teatro. She makes 2,625 soles per month as a teacher and sells about 7,500 soles per month in books, which is the equivalent of approximately $920 and $2,600. With this loan, she will invest in her bookstore.

All of the members of Virgen el Carmen appreciate and thank you for the loan and promise to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To use as business capital, including for a bookstore.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase manure and soil amendments

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Tiene 37 años, es viuda, tiene 4 hijos (3 varones y 1 mujer) y tiene estudios primarios incompletos(quinto de primaria).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace 2 años y se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
Su primer préstamo fuè de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con los que compró 2 ovinos. Paralelo a ello también realiza actividades agrícolas para autoconsumo.

Ella solicitará el monto de S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles con lo que comprará 1 toro para engordarlo en 3 meses y luego venderlo en la feria de ganado;indica a su vez que tiene forraje para engordarlo y que además serán meses de verde y habrá pasto.

Indica que en su  Banco Comunal se olvida de sus preocupaciones.

Su anhelo es que sus hijos sean mejores que ella y que su negocio siga prosperando.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Jesús de Nazaret" Community Bank in the Ilave district, province of El Collao, in the Puno district. Aged 37, she is a widow with 4 children (3 boys and 1 girl). She has completed 5th grade primary education. She has been a member of the Manuela R. Movement for 2 years, and she is in the business of buying and selling livestock. Her first loan, for $105, enabled her to buy 2 sheep. She also grows her own food. Rosa will use this $600 loan to buy a bull, fatten it for three months and then sell it at the livestock fair; she has the hay needed to fatten it, and it will be in the growing months, so there will be pasture. The Community Bank enables her to forget about her worries. Her dream is for her children to have a better life than she has had, and to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bull

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Teresa Pilar

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa tiene 28 años de edad, es casada, madre de 2 niños( 1 varón y 1 mujer ), estudió hasta 5to. de secundaria y vive en el Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao , Departamento de Puno.

Hace 6 meses integra el Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret”.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró 2 ovinos; ella se dedica al engorde de ovinos, para su posterior venta en carne directamente a  los consumidores, dicho negocio realiza hace 5 años desde que tiene su pareja.

Para que siga creciendo su negocio solicitará un nuevo crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles para comprar 4  ovinos.

Su visión es ver a sus hijos profesionales, aumentar más capital y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Teresa (28) is married and has 2 children (a boy and a girl); she completed 5th year of secondary education. She lives in the Ilave district, province of El Callao, Puno Department. She has been a member of the "Jesús de Nazaret" Community Bank for 6 months. She used her first loan ($105) to buy two sheep. She fattens sheep and then sells the meat directly to consumers. She has been in this business for 5 years, since she got married. To continue expanding, she needs a loan of $175 to buy 4 sheep. She wants her children to have a profession; she also wants to expand her capital and continue in business.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 4 sheep

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora MARIA ELIZABETH C. V. tiene 42 años, vive en el distrito de EL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. 
Pertenece al Banco Comunal LIDERESAS EN ACCION. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to. de primaria,  es casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen económicamente de ella. 
María se dedica a  cocinar en el club de madres y los fines de semana vende menús en su domicilio. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró arroz, fideos, menestras, papas, aceite, etc. para la preparación de sus menús.
Con su próximo crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles comprarà vasos, platos, cubiertos, arroz, azúcar, papas, menestras, etc. para su negocio.
Ella sueña con aumentar la venta de sus menús y así poder obtener mayores ganancias para la crianza y educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Elizabeth C. V. is 42. She lives in the El Porvenir district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Lideresas en Acción Communal Bank. She has a fifth grade education. She is married and has three children. Two of them are economically dependent upon her. María cooks in the Mothers’ Club. On the week ends she sells meals in her home. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought rice, noodles, legumes, potatoes, and oil, etc. for her meal preparation. With her next loan for 500 PEN she will buy cups, plates, cutlery, rice, sugar, potatoes, and legumes, etc. for her business. She dreams of increasing her meal sales . That way she will be able to get more income to raise and educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cups, plates, cutlery, rice, sugar, potatoes, and legumes, etc.

loans.name: Juntas Venceremos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El  banco comunal Juntas Venceremos es un banco que se encuentra en la ciudad de Cuenca, es una ciudad que fue declarada Patrimonio Cultural del Ecuador  por su riqueza arquitectónica y sus obras artísticas, el Centro Histórico está formado por la zona residencial más antigua, encontramos también la mayoría de iglesias con mérito arquitectónico, nuestras socias son personas que siempre lleva sus tradiciones en su corazón, su gentileza y amabilidad, siendo personas que buscan la manera de sobresalir en la vida.

La Sra.
