María Q. es socia del banco comunal Juntas Venceremos, vive  por la comunidad de la Calera en la ciudad de Cuenca,  tiene 42 años de edad y se encuentra casada, su esposo trabaja en la cerámica de Cuenca, es un gran pilar y ejemplo en su hogar, en esta unión conyugal han procreado 3 hijos que se encuentran de 14, 10 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo se encuentra estudiando en el Colegio y sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en la escuela, con el esfuerzo y sacrificio conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

María se dedica a los servicios de limpieza realizando este negocio hace 3 años y nos comenta que le va bien, también está comenzando con un negocio propio que es la elaboración de yogur y se encuentra realizando esta actividad hace 6 meses, aprendió la elaboración de este producto en un curso que tomo y ahora lo está poniendo en práctica, se lleva con todas las compañera del banco comunal con las que comparten sus historias de la vida cotidiana, se encuentra 3 años realizando los prestamos en la fundación y los prestamos le han beneficiado para mejorar un poco económicamente su hogar, con el nuevo préstamo que realiza en la fundación  va a invertir en la compra de  productos para la elaboración de su yogur, su mayor sueño es de ver a sus hijos ser unos profesionales y superarse en la vida.

La Sra. Sandra M. es socia del banco comunal Juntas Venceremos, vive por el sector de la Orquídeas, en la parroquia Hermano Miguel en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 39 años de edad, se encuentra divorciada hace 9 años, el motivo fue que su esposo viajo hacia el extranjero y se olvido de su familia y con el procreo 4 hijos, se encuentra con un nuevo compromiso con quien lleva 4 años y ha procreado 2 hijos uno se encuentra de 3 años  y su segundo hijo murió a los 25 días de nacido, la causa fue  por su enfermedad de diabetes, naciendo su hijo enfermo, su esposo trabaja como cobrador de un bus interprovincial.

Sandra se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, realizando esta actividad hace 2 años, trabaja recorriendo las fabricas en donde ya tiene conocidos y nos comenta que le está yendo bien, tiene una muy buena amistad con todas las socias del bankito, se encuentra en su tercer ciclo que realiza los prestamos en la fundación, y fue una amiga quien le incentivó  a que forme parte del banca, todos los prestamos que le han entregado le han beneficiado en su negocio y para su enfermedad, con el préstamo que recibe de fundación Espoir lo va a invertir en su negocio, su mayor sueño es de salir del país para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Juntas Venceremos Communal Bank is a bank in the city of Cuenca. It is a city that was declared the Cultural Patrimony of Ecuador for its fine architecture and artistic works. The Historical Center is formed by the oldest residential area. We can also find there the majority of churches of architectural value. Our members are people who always carry their traditions, their grace, and their kindness in their hearts. They are people looking for a way to succeed in life. María Q. is a member of the Juntas Venceremos Communal Bank. She lives in the Calera community in the city of Cuenca. She is 42 and married. Her husband works with ceramics in Cuenca. She is a great pillar and example in her household. They have three children who are 14, 10, and 8. Her first son is studying in college, and the last two are in school. With marital effort and sacrifice they have been able to build their own home. María has been providing cleaning services for three years. She tells us that it is going well. She is also starting her own business making yogurt. She has been doing this for six months. She learned how to make this product in a course that she took. Now she is putting it into practice. She gets along with all of her colleagues in the communal bank. She shares stories of daily life with them. She has been working with loans from the foundation for three years. The loans have benefited her household economic situation a little. She will use the new loan from the foundation to buy products to make yogurt. Her greatest dream is to see her children become professionals and succeed in life. Sandra M. is a member of the Juntas Venceremos Communal Bank. She lives in the Orquídes sector in the Hermano Miguel parish in the city of Cuenca. She is 39, and she has been divorced for nine years. Her husband traveled abroad and forgot his family. She had four children with him. She has been in a new relationship for four years. They have two children. One is three years old. The second child died 25 days after being born. The cause was her diabetes, and he was born sick. Her husband works as an interprovincial bus conductor. Sandra sells all types of clothes. She has been doing this for two years. She goes to the factories where she knows people. She tells us that it is going well. She has a good friendship with all of the members of their bank. She is in her third cycle of loans with the foundation. A friend motivated her to become part of the bank. All of the loans she has received have benefited her business and helped her illness. With this loan from the Espoir Foundation she will invest in her business. Her biggest dream is to leave the country to give her children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk, natural yogurt, and clothes like t-shirts and pants, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding and to buy fertilizer for the soil

loans.name: Ruth Pastora

texts.es:
La señora Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Tiene 24 años, es madre soltera,  tiene 1 hijo varón y estudió primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año; se dedica a  la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y paralelamente cria y vende animales menores y hace agricultura de autoconsumo.
Su primer préstamo fuè de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles con el que compró 2 ovinos.
Ella solicitará el monto de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, con los que comprará 1 vaca para llevarla a la plaza de ganado, venderla y comprar otra, renovando así cada mes su capital.

Indica que le gusta su  Banco Comunal porque aprende y reflexiona conjuntamente con otras socias sobre como salir adelante.

Su mayor anhelo es que su único hijo estudie y no sufra carencias ni abusos; indica ademàs que se esforzará en mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Jesús de Nazaret Communal Bank in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is a 24 year old single mother, and she has one son. She has an elementary school education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for one year. She buys and sells cattle. At the same time she raises and sells small animals. She also farms for her own consumption. With her first loan for 500 PEN she bought two sheep. She is asking for 1,000 PEN, which she will use to buy a cow. She will take it to the livestock market, sell it, and buy another. This way she replenishes her capital every month. She likes her communal bank because she learns and reflects with the other members about how to get ahead. Her biggest desire is that her only son go to school, does not need anything, and does not suffer from mistreatment. She will put forth great effort to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Santos Maria

texts.es: Doña Santos Maria G. vive en la colonia Peña Vieja es una zona que esta bien poblada, las calles son pavimentadas, las casas están de forma continua y cuenta con todos los servicios publicos, tiene 26 años de experiencia en la elaboracion de tortillas, compra el maiz para molerlo y la leña en un carro repartidor de leña, asimismo entrega un pedido de doscientos lempiras todos los días en una Institución de Gobierno que se llama Fundacion de Aldeas Infantiles (SOS), para ir a este lugar toma un bus que tarda en llegar una hora y le cuesta 3 lempiras, lo hace de lunes a viernes, vive con su esposo y su suegra, la cual tiene 80 años de edad y sus dos hijas. sus hijas en la mañana le ayudan a elaborar las tortillas ya que en la tarde van a la universidad y de esta forma doña Maria a podido salir adelante. Santos solicita el credito para comprar mas materia prima para elaborar mas tortillas y con las ganancias que obtenga hacer mejoras a su vivienda ya que la quiere ver mas grande. Doña maria invierte mensualmente $ 240.60 y vende $560.00 obteniendo una ganacia mensual de $ 319.40
texts.en:
Santos Maria G. lives in the neighborhood of Peña Vieja, which is a well-populated area with paved roads, attached houses and all public services. She has 26 years of experience preparing tortillas. She purchases the corn to grind and buys firewood from a distribution wagon. In turn, she delivers an order worth 200 lempiras [the local currency] every day to a governmental institution called the Children's Villages Foundation (SOS). To reach this location, she rides the bus, which takes an hour and costs her 3 lempiras. She does this Monday through Friday. She lives with her husband, her 80-year-old mother-in-law, and her two daughters. In the morning, her daughters help her prepare the tortillas, since they go to the university in the afternoon. In this way, Santos Maria has been able to get ahead. She is requesting the current loan to purchase ingredients and supplies to prepare more tortillas. With the profits she obtains, she will make improvements to her house, since she would like it to be larger. Santos Maria invests $240.60 in her business each month and has sales of $560.00, for a monthly profit of $319.40.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing corn, water, firewood, matches and lime

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming inputs

loans.name: Celmira

texts.es:
La señora CELMIRA C. V. , tiene  40 años, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE  II, presenta estudios hasta 5to. de Secundaria y tiene 1 hijo  quien depende económicamente de ella. 
La socia se dedica a  sembrar chala en sus chacras para luego venderla en los establos y con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò sacos de fertilizantes al por mayor para arar sus tierras y tener una buena siembra. 
Ahora con su próximo crédito de 2,300.00 nuevos comprará también fertilizantes.
Ella sueña con tener una buena cosecha para así poder generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Celmira C. V. is 40. She lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Siempre Adelante II Communal Bank. She went to school until the fifth year of high school. She has one child who is economically dependent upon her. She plants “chala” (corn husks and cobs) on her fields. She later sells them to stables. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought sacks of fertilizers wholesale. She used it to plough her land and to have a good planting. Now, with her next loan for 2,300 PEN, she will also buy fertilizers. She dreams of having a good harvest to be able to generate income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for plowing and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria Z. T. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la colonia la Era de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas de maiz, tiene varios años de experiencia en elaborar tortillas, tiene clientes fijos los cuales son vecinos cercanos a la casa de habitacion y tambien varios negocios de cafeterias y pulperias.
ahora no se da abasto con toda la produccion que tiene , esta produciendo muy poco y para eso necesita el credito para comprar mas materia prima para la elaboracion de las tortillas.
esta espoca es de mucha demanda y quiere cumplir con todas las necesidades de sus clientes.
su meta a es arreglar su casa y que sea muy comoda para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria Z. T. is 41 years old. She lives in the Era district of the city of Tegucigalpa. She works making and selling corn tortillas. She has many years of experience making tortillas. She has steady customers who are close neighbors and also various businesses, cafeterias and shops.

Right now, she can’t cope with all the work that she has. She is making very little, and therefore needs a loan to buy more raw materials to make her tortillas.

This is a season of high demand, and she wants to meet all the needs of her customers.

Her goal is to sort out her home so that it is very comfortable for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, water, firewood and lime

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for plowing and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda  es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” desde hace 4 años, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo. Cuenta con estudios secundarios completos y se dedica a la venta de cereales y carne.
Hilda nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 2200.00 con el cual podrá comprar más mercadería como: chuño, papa, habas, cebada, carne.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Ilave.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros que ganarà y las actividades con las promotoras.
texts.en:
Hilda has been a member of the Community Bank "3 de Mayo" for 4 years. in the district of Llave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 23 years old, lives with her partner and has one child. She completed secondary studies and now makes a living by selling cereals and meats.

Hilda tells us that, with the first loan she obtained through the Manuela Ramos Movement, which was for S/. 300.00 new soles, she was able to increase her capital. Now, she's requesting a loan of S/. 2,200.00 new soles with which she will be able to purchase more merchandise, such as potato flower, potatoes, beans, barley and meat.

Her dream for the future is to have a house in Llave. As for the Community Bank, she is very fond of the money she will earn through savings as well as the promotional activities they offer.


Translated from Spanish by Joseph Mulligan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potato flower, potatoes, barley, beans, meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Susana Rosario

texts.es:
Susana es una mujer emprendedora y muy dinámica, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali. Tiene 38 años, madre D. 4 hijos D. los cuales uno es mayor D. edad; cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien es contador.
Se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres perseverantes II” desD. hace dos años. 
El primer crédito que recibió fuè D. 300.00 nuevos soleslos que le permitieron invertir en colonias, talcos, lápiz labiales y otros productos D. belleza.  
En la actualidad necesita un crédito D. 3000.00 soles que serán utilizados para la compra D. una gran variedad D. productos D. belleza los que venderà a sus clientes. 
La meta D. Susana es tener una tienda D. prendas D. vestir y accesorios para damas.
texts.en:
Susana is a dynamic and enterprising woman. She lives in Pucalpa, in the region of Ucayali. She's 38 years old, the mother of four children, the oldest of which is grown up. She has the support of her husband who is an accountant. Her livelihood is the sale of beauty products.

She has been a member of the Community Bank's "Mujeres preseverantes II" (Persevering Women II) for two years now. The first loan she received was for S/. 300.00 new soles which enabled her to invest in colognes, powders, lipstick and other beauty products.

She currently needs a loan of S/. 3,000.00 new soles which will be used for the purchase of a wiD. variety of beauty products that she will sell to her customers. Susana's goal is to have a store with clothing and accessories for women.


Translated from Spanish by Joseph Mulligan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of a wide variety of beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her soil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.en:
Marcia is the coordinator of her group Arco Iris (Rainbow), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the slums that ring Santo Domingo, specifically to the north of the city, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home as a single mother here in a simple structure with her 2 children.

Marcia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and looks forward to continuing to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business as a massage therapist by selling products that pertain to her business such as massage oils, pain relief creams, etc. She will use the profits to invest in buying a small plot of land on which she can begin to build her own home, with the long term goal of seeing her two children become professionals in order to lead a better life. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase lotions and other products to be sold in her massage business.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer 2 Group

texts.en:
Rosa is the coordinator of her group called Nuevo Renacer (New Rebirth), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in North Santo Domingo, among the slums that ring the city, where crime is prevalent and running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and child.

Rosa is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans without incident. She plans to use this loan to invest in her fantasia (fantasy), a business which caters to women, by purchasing combs, shampoo, conditioner and blouses to sell in her business. She will use the profits to save money and also on special treatments for her daughter who is mute and deaf, a large financial burden. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase combs, shampoos, conditioners, blouses.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La señora Hilaria es socia del banco comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 46 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 3  hijos que  viven con ella y el mayor tiene esposa. Estudió primaria incompleta. 
Hilaria trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 4 años; se dedica a la compra y venta D. productos D. la región los cuales compra D. las señoras D. Ilave para luego venderlas en Tacna.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró 4 corderitos para engordarlos y así aumentar su negocio.
Ella solicitará un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en comprar productos D. la región que luego llevará semanalmente a Tacna para venderlos, ya que existe negocio para los granos.
Su visión hacia el futuro es ser mayorista y así aumentar màs su capital.
Lo que màs le gusta D. su banco comunal son las capacitaciones que dan las socias.
texts.en:
Hilaria is a member of the community bank "La Brisas del Río Blanco" in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 46 years old, is married and has 3 children who live with her. The oldest has a wife. She began her primary education but did not finish.

Hilaria has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 4 years now. She earns a living by purchasing regional products from the women of Llave in order to sell them in Tacna.

She tells us that, with her first loan of S/. 300.00 new soles, she purchased 4 young lambs to fatten them up for sale and in this way grow her business. She is requesting a loan of S/. 3,000.00 new soles, which she will invest in the purchase of regional products. These she will take to Tacna to sell on a weekly basis, since there is already a good market for grains there.

In the future, she sees herself being a wholesaler and, in this way, growing her capital even more. What she likes most about her community bank are the training courses offered to the members.


Translated from Spanish by Joseph Mulligan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of regional products

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet, 35 years old and married with three children between the ages of 7 and 13 years, runs Mama Sharon, a water-vending business. She has been in business for two years and has one employee. Describing herself as hardworking, Janet also earns some income selling chicken.  She is requesting this loan for Kes. 20,000 from Faulu to buy chickens (Kes. 10,000) and a water tank (Kes. 10,000) and in the future hopes to expand her business and provide a better education and standard of living for her children.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and a water tank.

loans.name: Neomila

texts.es:
Neomila es una socia trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali.
Tiene 43 años de edad, madre de tres hijos, todos mayores de edad.Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es docente de primaria.
Neomila se dedica a la venta de jugos, la cual realiza en su casa.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “De la Amistad” desde hace once años, donde se ha caracterizado por ser puntualy activa.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles, que utilizó para comprar frutas y venderlas en su casa. 
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados para la compra de mesas, sillas y licuadora para implementar su negocio; así mismo invertirá en la compra de calaminas para cambiar el techo de su negocio. 
La meta de Neomila es llegar a tener un restaurant y muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Neomila is a hardworking and dynamic partner. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is 43 years old and the mother of three children, all adults. She has the support of her husband, who is a schoolteacher. Neomila earns her living selling juice, which she does from her home. She has been a member of the communal bank "De la Amistad" for eleven years. She has been characterized there as being punctual and active. The first loan she received was for 300.00 nuevos soles, which she used to purchase fruit and sell it in her house. Now she needs a loan of 1000.00 nuevos soles which will be used to purchase tables, chairs and a blender to use in her business. She will also invest in corrugated iron sheets to change the roof of her business. Neomila's goal is to be able to have a restaurant and many clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase tables, chairs, and a blender to use in her business.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora  AURORA V. C. , tiene  34 años, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE  II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to. de secundaria y tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a  la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. 
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò ropa para damas  como: jeans, polos, blusas, pantalones, sàbanas, edredones, etc. 
Con su próximo crédito de 1,100 nuevos soles viajarà a la ciudad de Lima a comprar ropa como: vestidos, polos, faldas, jeans, polos, blusas, pijamas, etc. 
Ella sueña con adecuar un espacio en su domicilio en donde pueda exhibir la ropa que venderá.
texts.en:
Aurora V. C. is 34. She lives in the Moche district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She is a member of the Siempre Adelante II Communal Bank. She went to school until the fifth year of high school. She has three children who are economically dependent upon her. She sells clothes for women, men, and children. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought women’s clothes like jeans, polo shirts, blouses, pants, sheets, and quilts, etc. With her next loan for 1,100 PEN she will travel to the city of Lima to buy clothes like dresses, polo shirts, skirts, jeans, blouses, and pajamas, etc. She dreams of adapting a space in her home where she could display the clothes that she will sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Travel to the city of Lima to buy clothes like dresses, polo shirts, skirts, jeans, blouses, and pajamas, etc.

loans.name: Noily

texts.en:
Noily is 42 years old. She lives on a farm with her husband, Fray Araya Masís, and their son and daughter. Their farm is located in the rural region of Turrialba, in the central valley of Costa Rica. Noily has a small business producing and selling cheese. Fray works on a local sugar cane farm as an agricultural labourer. This will be Noily´s second loan from Fundacion Mujer. Her first loan, for 100,000 colones, was paid back, on time and in full, in only six months. 

Noily has been producing and selling cheese for 2 years. She started her business with an investment of 600,000 colones. She owns 4 cows and can extract 15 litres of milk per day from each cow. Depending on the quality of milk, 15 litres can yield 2-3 kilograms of cheese. Cheese production is an intricate process that requires attention to detail at every step to ensure a quality product. Because cheese is easily contaminated, Noily must invest in expensive bacteria-fighting chemicals. Noily has found it challenging to manage this necessary cost. In a good week, she produces and sells 45 kilograms of cheese. At 1400 colones per kilogram, this translates into 250,000 colones per month. In a bad month, she might earn 140,000 colones. 

Noily is applying for a loan of 350,000 colones to buy another cow so she can increase her weekly cheese output. Her long term goals are to buy more cows and improve the cheese-production process by creating a workshop separate from her house. At the moment, Noily's kitchen doubles as her cheese-production facility. Noily also wants a line of credit from Fundacion Mujer. This loan is a step in the loan process to qualify Noily for a line of credit.

Rural areas, such as Turrialba, are characterized by many difficulties, such as a lack of job opportunities, infrastructural deficiencies, low levels of formal education, and lack of available financial services. The highest level of formal education Noily has attained is the completion of primary school. Nevertheless, she has developed her talent for the art of commerce. Noily has arranged for a distributor from San Jose (the capital of Costa Rica) to pass by her farm every week. This distributor purchases all the cheese that Noily and her son have been able to produce. The cheese distributor travels from Turrialba to San Jose, where he sells the cheese to various restaurants and shops. 

The field consultant who has been working with Noily for the past 2 years has described Noily as shy, sincere, and hard working. Loans from Fundacion Mujer have helped her to overcome personal obstacles in periods of depression. Running her business and the resulting relationships she has formed have helped her and her family significantly.

During the 1980's, in an effort to fight the plague of poverty, the Costa Rican government decided to allocate land to impoverished citizens. The Institute of Agricultural Development (IDA) is the governmental body responsible for the selection and approval of citizens for land allotments. Many IDA land recipients, although grateful for the government’s efforts, lack the necessary funds, as well as agricultural know-how, that would allow them to use their lands in an efficient and productive manner. Noily and her family were allocated land because they met the criteria for extreme poverty. Despite her entrepreneurial spirit, Noily's efforts have been hamstrung due to her exclusion from the traditional banking system. 

This is where you can help. Your loan is a direct investment to improve the living conditions of a family living in a poor community of central Costa Rica. By lending to Noily, a proactive and hard-working entrepreneur, you are enabling her to take the first steps on a path that leads to the end of poverty.

loans.use: To buy a cow for her cheese-making business

loans.name: Thigingi

texts.en:
Thigingi is married with a six-month-old daughter. For the last five years, he has run a business selling Safaricom mobile phone airtime scratch cards wholesale. He also runs a food kiosk. Thigingi was previously employed as a sales representative for Safaricom. He describes himself as hardworking and industrious. Due to Faulu's training, Thigingi says he has become focused on business and started saving.
Thigingi has requested a loan for 20,000 KES from Kiva partner Faulu to purchase scratch cards in values higher than 250 KES each. In the future, he would like to be a registered reseller with Safaricom and expand to branches elsewhere in Nairobi.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone airtime scratch cards for resale

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es:
El banco comunal Prosperidad esta formado por un grupo de amigas que por la necesidad de salir adelante y demostrar a su familia e hijos que en la vida todo es posible solo hay que ponerle ganas y el deseo de superación, formaron el grupo para tener créditos y así hacer crecer sus negocios, viven por la urbe de la ciudad de C., es una ciudad guarda muchas tradiciones, lugar de ensueños y quienes visitan a C. regresan a sus lugares de origen con la promesa de volver por la belleza que está guarda.

La Sra. Blanca Gutiérrez es socia del banco comunal la Prosperidad, tiene 46 años de edad, se encuentra casada y ha procreado 2 hijos que se encuentran de  25 y 17 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y estudia en la universidad Unita, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio La Salle, su esposo trabaja como jefe de planta en una prestigiosa empresa de muebles Colineal, siendo la demostración de su esfuerzo y trabajo el haber construido su casa propia.

Blanca trabaja en la distribución de telas, comenzando hace 10 años y poco a poco ha ido creciendo con su negocio, nos comenta que le va bien porque ya cuenta con una clientela selecta y sus clientes le llaman telefónicamente para realizar los pedidos entrega los pedidos al domicilio, hay veces que los clientes llegan hasta su local para llevar la mercadería, se una socia de un gran carisma y se lleva con todas las compañeras de su banca comunal, tiene un año realizando los prestamos en la fundación y nos comenta que le han beneficiado en una parte en su hogar y negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que realiza lo va a invertir en incrementar su negocio, su meta es de seguir creciendo junto con su negocio.
texts.en:
The Prosperidad community bank is made up of a group of friends that share the need to get ahead and show their families and children that in this life, anything is possible if only there is the will and desire to overcome. They formed this group to get loans in order to grow their businesses. The live in an urban area in the city of C., a city that holds onto many traditions, a place of dreams where everyone who visits will leave with the promise to return for the beauty that is preserved.

Blanca Gutiérrez is a member of the Prosperidad community bank. She is 46 years old, married and has two children that are 25 and 17 years old. Her older son works and studies at the UNITA university. Her second son is at La Salle high school. Her husband works as the plant manager of a prestigious furniture business, Colineal. His demonstration of hard work is seen in his ability to build his own home.

Blanca works in the distribution of fabrics. She began 10 years ago and little by little, has grown her business. She tells us that everything is going well, because she already has a select clientele. Her customers call her by phone to put in orders that are delivered to their households. There are occasions when her customers come to her shop to pick up merchandise. She is a charismatic member and gets along with all her companions at the community bank. She has been receiving loans for one year with this institution, and tells us that she has benefitted in her home and business. With this loan, she is going to invest in growing her business. Her goal is to continue growing along with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth Rodríguez es una mujer dinámica y optimista, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 57 años, madre soltera de 6 hijos, de los cuales cuatro son mayores de edad. Elizabeth se dedica a la venta de golosinas, actividad que realiza en su casa. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fuè 300.00 nuevos soles que invirtió en la compra de golosinas. 
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1200.00 nuevos soles que invertirá en golosinas e ingredientes, ya que vende menús en el colegio Santa Rosa. 
La meta de Elizabeth es ampliar su negocio de venta de comida y seguir mejorando económicamente.
texts.en:
Elizabeth R. is a dynamic and optimistic woman. She lives in the district of Manantay, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 57 and is a single mother of 6 children, four of whom are adults. Elizabeth works from her home selling candies. She has been involved with the “Las Divinas” Community Bank for two years. The first credit she received was for 300 Peruvian soles, which she invested in buying candies. Now she needs a credit of 1200 Peruvian soles to invest in candies and ingredients, because she also sells prepared meals at Santa Rosa School. Elizabeth's goal is to expand her food sales business and continue to better he economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will invest one part of the loan in candies and the other part in ingredients to prepare food for sale.

loans.name: Sicily

texts.en:
Sicily is 30 years old and married with two young children, aged three and eight. She sells second-hand clothing and has been in this business for three years. She describes herself as hardworking and focused, and says that through her training with Kiva partner Faulu she has learned how to plan and keep records for her business.
Sicily has requested a loan for 20,000 KES from Faulu to buy additional clothing stock. Her hope is to have a stable family and a good business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of used clothing

loans.name: Martha Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora  MARTHA EMPERATRIZ M. V. tiene  38 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE  II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria y tiene 2 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella . 
La socia se dedica a  confeccionar ropa para damas y niños y paralelamente realiza tejidos como tapetes, manteles, chompas, bufandas, etc.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò telas, hilos, cierres, etc.  para realizar los pedidos que tenìa pendiente.
Con su próximo crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles comprará lana al por mayor, telas , agujas, hilos , cierres, etc.  para la confección de ropa y manteles.
Ella sueña con obtener màs clientes y poder confeccionar mayor cantidad de prendas y asì generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha Emperatriz M. Velásquez is 38 years old and lives in the District of Moche, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Siempre Adelante II” (Always Ahead II). Maria completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She has two children who are financially dependent on her.

Martha produces clothing for women and children. At the same time, she weaves items such as rugs, tablecloths, sweaters, scarves, etc. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy fabric, thread, zippers, and other items so that she could fulfill her pending orders. This next loan of 800 soles will be used to purchase wool wholesale, fabric, needles, thread, zippers, and other supplies for producing clothing and tablecloths. She hopes to obtain more customers and produce a larger quantity of garments in order to generate more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials & supplies

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 40 years old and married with two school-aged daughters. He has a business selling men's caps. He has been in business for five years and has two employees. John describes himself as hardworking and committed, and says that through Faulu's training he has learned the art of record-keeping, customer care, and how to manage the business more professionally.
John has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Kiva partner Faulu to purchase more stock to establish his business. In the future, he hopes to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy more hats to sell

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana A. es una mujer perseverante y trabajadora; vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 42 años, es madre de 3 hijos(2 de ellos mayores de edad)y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja independientemente.
Liliana se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Fray Martín de Porres” desde hace un año. 
El primer crédito que recibió fuè de 300.00 soles, que utilizó para comprar gaseosas.  
En la actualidad necesita un crédito de 1000.00 soles, que serán utilizados para la compra ropa de segunda mano y posteriormente ser vendida a sus clientes. 
La meta de Liliana es tener una fuente de soda con gran variedad en postres y refrescos.
texts.en:
Liliana A. is a persevering and hardworking woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, region of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are adults. Liliana has the support of her husband who is self-employed.

She sells secondhand clothing. Liliana joined the Communal Bank “Fray Martín de Porres” one year ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to buy sodas. She now needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy secondhand clothing to sell later to her customers.

Liliana's goal is to open a soda fountain where she can offer a wide variety of desserts and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase secondhand clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase corn flour, lime, water, firewood, matches

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder tiene 32 años, vive con su hijo Diego de 10  años, y con su suegra, ya que su esposa viajó a otro país para trabajar.

Desde hace 3 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros, actividad a la cual empezó a dedicarse gracias a que su padre poseía un carro; aprendiendo desde muy joven este oficio. Adicionalmente, apoya en el negocio de su suegra, que es una pequeña bodega, la cual ya empieza a arrojar sus primeros frutos, pues cada vez está mejor implementada. Es así que ambos se ayudan en bienestar de su hijo y nieto, para que pueda salir adelante. 
Para el futuro, Wilder quiere mejorar la tienda de su suegra, pues sabe que es un negocio más  rentable y se puede obtener mayores beneficios, sin descuidar su propio trabajo.

Este es su onceavo préstamo con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en sus pagos, como el resto de su grupo, quienes son buenos amigos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de productos para implementar la tienda de su suegra y así obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Wilder is 32 years old. He lives with his 10-year-old son, Diego, and his mother-in-law. His wife has left for work in another country.

For 3 years, he has offered passenger transportation services. He was able to get into this thanks to his father who owned a car and has been learning this trade since a young age. Also, he supports his mother-in-law’s business, which is a small grocery store, which is already starting to bring its first fruits. Everyday, it is better stocked. In this way, they both support the wellbeing of his son and her grandson, so that they can get ahead.

In the future, Wilder wants to improve his mother-in-law’s store. He knows that it’s a profitable business and that it could bring benefits without neglecting his own business.

This is his eleventh loan with MFP, and he’s always been very punctual with his payments, like the rest of his group, all good friends. With this loan, he will buy more products to stock his mother-in-law’s store and, in this way, obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del banco comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo. Estudiò hasta quinto de secundaria.
Margarita trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años y tiene su tienda de abarrotes.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fuè de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, los gastó en el hogar.
Ella solicitara un préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes y a la vez en gastos del hogar.
Su visión hacia el futuro es dedicarse a la crianza de animales.
Lo que màs le gusta de su banco comunal son las reuniones y de esa manera poder participar en todo lo referente a las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Margarita is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” (The Breezes of Río Blanco), which is located in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 37 years old, married, and has one child. Margarita completed her education through the fifth year of secondary school.

She started working with Manuela Ramos four years ago and now operates a grocery store. Margarita says her first loan was in the amount of 300 soles and was used to pay her household expenses. She is requesting another loan in the amount of 300 soles to invest in her grocery store as well as pay household expenses. Her vision for the future is to raise animals on a full-time basis.

What Margarita enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings where she is able to participate in all matters relating to the members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery items & pay household expenses

loans.name: Milisa

texts.en:
Milisa is a 56-year-old widow with two adult children. She has a greengrocery business and sells vegetables, tomatoes, onions, and bananas. She has been in this business for 27 years and has one employee. Milisa describes herself as hardworking and determined. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Kiva partner Faulu to buy vegetables (10,000 KES) and tomatoes and onions (10,000 KES).

Milisa says that through Faulu's training she has learned new business skills. Her hope for the future is simply to have a good quality of life and grow her business to be able to sell other products.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables, tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY CORN FLOUR, LIME, FIREWOOD, WATER, AND MATCHES

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA G. D. F. tiene  72 años, 12 hijos todos mayores D. edad y vive en el distrito D. la Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE  II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 3ero. D. primaria, refiere que no pudo continuar estudiando por falta D. recursos económicos.
La socia se dedica a la preparación y venta D. tofees y chocotejas. 
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò chocolates en barra al por mayor, pasas, pecanas y papel para envolver.
Con su próximo crédito D. 1,000 nuevos soles comprará moldes, cajas D. chocolates al por mayor , 2 ollas , pecanas, pasas, papel D. envoltura, etc. para la preparación y empaquetado D. sus productos.
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y empezar a distribuir sus tofees y chocolates en las tiendas D. otros distritos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria G. D. Fernández is 72 years old and has 12 adult children. She lives in the District of Moche, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Siempre Adelante II” (Always Ahead II). She has a third graD. education and was not able to continue studying because she lacked the financial resources.

Maria prepares and sells toffees and chocolates. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought bars of chocolate wholesale, raisins, pecans, and wrapping paper. Her next loan of 1000 soles will be used to buy molds, boxes of chocolates at wholesale, two pots, pecans, raisins, wrapping paper, and other items for preparing and packing her products. She dreams of increasing her sales and distributing her products to stores in other districts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for making chocolates and toffees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes, creams, lotions and childrens' clothes

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania Guzmán es una socia dinámica y trabajadora que lucha por sus ideales; vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 34 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, es madre de 2 hijos menores y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a vender pasajes aèreos.
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Perseverantes II” desde hace dos años y ocho meses. 
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 soles los que invirtió en colonias, talco y lápiz labial. Ahora necesita un crédito  de 1000.00 soles que serán utilizados en la compra de productos de belleza. 
La meta de Tania es tener un local implementado con artículos de belleza para y asì obtener más clientes.
texts.en:
Tania Guzmán is one of our dynamic and hardworking members who fights for her ideals. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. Tania is 34 years old and the mother of two young children. She sells beauty products and has the support of her husband, who sells air travel tickets.

Two years and eight months ago, Tania joined the Communal Bank “Mujeres Perseverantes II” (Persevering Women II). The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles, which was used to buy colognes, talcum powders, and lipsticks. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy more beauty products.

Tania’s goal is to have her own store where she can sell beauty products and attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY BEANS, SUGAR, RICE, BREAD, SOFT DRINKS, COOKIES, INSTANT SOUPS, PASTA, SALSA, TOILET PAPER, SANITARY NAPKINS, SOAP, SPICES, EGGS, MILK, ETC.

loans.name: Mirla Manuela

texts.es:
Mirla es una mujer dinámica  y entusiasta, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali- Perù. Tiene 57 años, es madre de 3 hijos (todos mayores de edad)y cuenta con una bodega de abarrotes, donde vende al por menor la cual està ubicada en su casa. Trabaja junto a su esposo quien es comerciante,  el cual también apoya en los gastos económicos de sus 2 hijos que están en la Universidad  de la ciudad de Huánuco. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal "Las  Lomas de Yarina" desde hace cinco años.
El primer crédito que recibió en este banco fuè de 300.00 soles, los que le permitieron invertir en lencería(ropas interiores femeninas). 
En la actualidad ella necesita un crédito de 1500.00 soles que le permitirán invertir en artículos de abarrotes para surtir su bodega, ya que va creciendo progresivamente, por lo que ahora cuenta con màs productos para ofrecer a su público. 
La meta de Mirla es ampliar su negocio y también tener artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Mirla is a dynamic and enthusiastic woman who lives in the District of Yarina Cocha, in the Ucayali region of Peru. She is 57 years old and the mother of three adult children.

Mirla operates a retail grocery store located in her home. She works with her husband, who is a merchant, to provide financial support for two of their children who attend the University of Huánuco.

Mirla joined the Communal Bank “Las Lomas de Yarina” five years ago. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles, which allowed her to invest in lingerie. Now she is requesting a loan of 1500 soles to buy grocery items to restock her store, which is growing steadily, and offer more merchandise to the public.

Mirla’s goal is to expand her business by also offering housewares.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her store with more groceries

loans.name: Norma Licha

texts.es:
La señora NORMA LICHA G. R. tiene 26años, cuenta con estudios secundarios concluìdos, tiene 1 hijo quien depende economicamente de ella y vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. 
Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS. 
Norma  se dedica a la venta de zapatos y sandalias para bebès.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò 3 docenas de sandalias para bebès que llevò al centro  de Trujillo para ser vendidas. 
Ahora con su próximo crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles comprarà zapatos y sandalias de bebès.
Ella sueña con alquilar un stand en un centro comercial de Trujillo para la venta de calzado.
texts.en:
Sra. Norma Licha G. R. is 26 years old and has one dependent child. She completed her high school education and lives in the District of El Porvenir, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú.

Norma is a member of the Communal Bank “Semillitas Creativas” (Little Seeds of Creativity). She sells shoes and sandals for babies. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy 3 dozen pairs of baby sandals to sell in central Trujillo. She is now requesting her next loan of 800 soles to buy shoes and sandals for babies. Her dream is to rent a stand at a shopping center in Trujillo where she can sell shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes & sandals for babies

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La señora MARIA ESTHER S. D. A. tiene  50 años, cuenta con estudios tècnicos en corte y confecciòn , tiene 7 hijos D. los cuales 3 dependen D. ella econòmicamentey vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SIEMPRE ADELANTE  II y se dedica a  la preparación y venta D. menús y paralelamente a la siembra d alfalfa, camote y choclo en las chacras que tiene cerca a su casa.
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò  arroz, azúcar, papas, fideos, aceite, menestras, etc.  para la elaboraciòn D. los menús. 
Ahora con su próximo crédito D. 800.00nuevos comprará también 2 sacos D. arroz, 1 saco D. papa y fertilizantes para arar sus chacras.
Ella sueña con tener un restaurante campestre donD. pueda vender platos típicos D. Moche.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Esther Sigueñas D. A. is 50 years old and has taken technical courses in sewing and dressmaking. She has 7 children of whom 3 are still financially dependent. Maria lives in the District of Moche, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú.

She is a member of the Communal Bank Siempre Adelante II (Always Ahead II) and engages in preparing and selling food. At the same time, she grows alfalfa, sweet potatoes, and corn in the fields she owns near her home. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy rice, sugar, potatoes, noodles, oil, dried vegetables, and other ingredients for preparing meals.

Maria is now requesting her next loan of 800 soles to buy two sacks of rice, one sack of potatoes, and fertilizers for her fields. Her dream is to open a rustic style restaurant where she can serve traditional dishes of the Moche region.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her food business & fertilizers to apply to her fields

loans.name: María Herminia

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive desde hace tres años junto a su cuñada en el sector Punto Nueve, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores en su domicilio, los corrales donde los cría están construidos de barro, adobe y carrizo. Usualmente cría pavos, patos, chanchos, pollos y chivos los cuales engorda para luego venderlos en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo) o a los negociantes que eventualmente frecuentan la zona. Por otro lado se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chicha (bebida tìpica hecha a base de maíz). Estos ingresos son los únicos con los que cuenta para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ella se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus aves y cerdos.

Su más grande anhelo es poder terminar de construir su casa, que está construída de material rústico, ya que las lluvias que se presentan durante los meses de verano siempre debilitan sus estructuras. Ella es una madre trabajadora, responsable y que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de su condición de madre soltera.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old, a single mother with 2 children, and has lived for the last 3 years with her sister-in-law in the Punto Nueve sector of Mochumí district, located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For 5 years she has been raising and selling small livestock from her home. The corrals in which she raises them are constructed of clay, adobe and reeds. Usually, she raises turkeys, ducks, pigs, chickens, and goats, which she fattens in order to sell them in Moshoqueque, the wholesale market for Chiclayo, or to the traders who frequent the zone. She also dedicates herself to making and selling chicha (the typical local corn drink). These are the only income sources on which she can count to pay family expenses.

She is soliciting a loan through EDPYME Alternativa for the first time. María needs 1,000 new sols to invest in buying feed for a balanced diet for her birds and pigs.

Her greatest wish is to be able to finish constructing her house, which is made of rustic material, since the rain that comes during the winter months always damages such structures.

She is a hard-working and responsible mother who has been able to advance, despite her condition as a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A BALANCED DIET FOR THE BIRDS AND PIGS SHE RAISES AND SELLS

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La señora  LUZ MARIA R. S. tiene 45 años, vive en el distrito de EL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú y pertenece al Banco Comunal LIDERESAS EN ACCIÒN.
La socia tiene estudios secundarios completos, tiene 2 hijos, de los cuales uno depende económicamente de ella.
Luz se dedica al cuidado de 8 niños en el wawawasi que tiene en la casa de su hermana y paralelamente a la cría de cuyes para la venta los fines de semana en el mercado cercano a su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró alimentos para los cuyes y también vasos, tazas, jarras para el wawawasi.
Con su próximo crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprará alimento para los cuyes como: engorde, panca, 1 saco de alimento balanceado y alfalfa.
Luz sueña con tener una tienda de comestibles en su casa para así generar mayores ingresos en la familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz Maria R. S. is 45 years old and lives in the District of El Porvenir, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Lideresas en Acción” (Leaders in Action). Luz completed her high school education and has two dependent children.

Luz takes care of 8 children at the day care center she operates at her sister’s house. At the same time, she raises guinea pigs to sell on the weekends at the market near her house. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy feed for her guinea pigs as well as glasses, cups, and pitchers for her day care center. With this next loan of 300 soles, she will buy food to fatten her guinea pigs, such as corn husks, alfalfa, and 1 sack of nutritional feed.

Luz dreams of opening a grocery store in her home so that she can generate more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Luz Y Sol Group

texts.es: El grupo “Luz y Sol” esta representado por la señora Yara y conformada por 12 miembros  de los cuales una mayorías son padres y madres de familia y representan el sustento de sus hogares. Una gran mayoría de las socias se dedican al comercio de productos como la venta de comida, venta de pan, ropa, promotoras y a los servicio de empleos domésticos, servicios de peluquería, costura y los  varones a  la   actividad del trasporte y albañilería. La  competencia  en respeto  a sus negocios es fuerte, ya que las señoras y caballeros trabajan duro y requiere de mucho sacrificio para sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios. El crédito será utilizado para capital de trabajo como la compra de insumos, materiales herramientas nuevas y repuestos para sus vehículos que agilicen su trabajo y que ayuden a generar un mejor ingreso para el bienestar de sus familias. La socias cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la Fundación Agrocapital a la cual le agradecen `por la confiadaza y el apoyo económico brindado ya que con ellos podrán sacar adelante a sus negocios y mejora la calidad de vida de sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “Luz y Sol” is represented by Yara and consists of 12 members, of which most are mothers and fathers of the family and represent the means of support in their homes. A large majority of the members are involved in commerce such as food, bread, or clothing sales, and promotion and services such as domestic employees, hair salon services, and sewing. The men are involved in transport and bricklaying. The competition in respect to their businesses is strong since the men and women work hard and it requires a great deal of sacrifice to help their small businesses get ahead.

The loan will be used as working capital for the purchase of food supplies, new tools, and spare parts for their cars that speed up their work and help to generate better income for the well-being of their families. The members have experience with solidarity groups, thanks to funds from organizations similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They are appreciative of Fundación Agrocapital for the confidence and economic support they provide, since with them the members will be able to get ahead with their businesses and improve the quality of life of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del  Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, vive en el distrito de Puno, provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, cuenta con grado de instruciòn superior completa y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fuè de S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de cosméticos.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.900.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que invertirá en la compra  de cosméticos como: labiales, delineadores, etc.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda de cosméticos.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is a member of the "Señor de la Justicia" community bank and lives in the Puno district, in the Puno province in the Puno department! She is 30 years old and married with 4 children. She completed high school and now sells beauty products. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the last year and her first loan as part of her community bank was for 500.00 nuevos soles, which she used to buy cosmetics. She would like a loan of 900 nuevos soles which she will also invest in cosmetics such as lipsticks and eyeliners, etc. Her goal is to have a small beauty product store. Her favorite part of her village bank is the savings feature and how punctual they all are.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lipsticks and eyeliners

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 30 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos de 9, 6, 4 y 3 años de edad. Vive junto a su familia en el caserío Punto 9, distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de tres años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. El nos comenta que la iniciativa de este negocio nació de la necesidad de buscar una fuente de ingreso que le ayude a solventar los gastos familiares, ya que lo que percibe como obrero agrícola no le abastece para sustentar a los suyos.

Usualmente compra pollos, patos, pavos y chanchos que luego cría hasta engordarlos para venderlos en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo). Juan viaja de dos a tres veces por mes a este lugar para ofrecer su mercadería. Además su trabajo como obrero agrícola lo absorve a diario: trabaja todos los días desde las seis hasta las doce del mediodía en las parcelas vecinas y por las tardes se dedica a la crianza y cuidado de sus animales.

Juan se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más animales para críarlos y posteriormente venderlos.

Su más grande anhelo es poder brindarle una educación de calidad a sus hijos, así como poder comprar un terreno de cultivo para poder empezar a sembrar sus propios productos. El es un padre de familia bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 30 years old, married, and has four children who are 9, 6, 4, and 3 years old. He lives together with his family in the Punto 9 neighborhood in the Mochumí district, located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than three years, he has been working to raise and sell animals. He told us that the initiative for the business began with the necessity to look for a source of income that would help him to cover family expenses, since what he receives as an agricultural worker doesn’t provide enough to support his expenses.

He generally buys chickens, ducks, turkeys, and pigs, which he then raises so they are big enough to sell in the Moshoqueque market (wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo). Juan travels two to three times per month to the market to sell his animals. In addition, he is occupied with his work as an agricultural worker on a daily basis: he works everyday from 6am to noon in the neighboring land, and in the afternoons he works raising and taking care of his animals.

Juan is asking for his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa, a loan of 1000 PEN, which he plans to use for the purchase of more animals to raise and later, to sell.

His greatest wish is to be able to provide a quality education for his children and to be able to purchase farmland to begin to plant his own products. He is a very hardworking and devoted father to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of domestic animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. la Candelaria” desD. hace 3 años, del distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 54 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 6 hijos, cuenta con estudios primarios completos y tiene su panadería.
Angélica nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para poder comprar insumos para su panadería.
Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar más ingredientes para la elaboraciòn D. panes como: azúcar, manteca, levadura, leña, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es hacer crecer su panadería.
Lo que màs le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sra. Angélica has been a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen D. la Candelaria” for three years. The bank is in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 54 years old, married, and has 6 children. Angélica completed her elementary school education and operates a bakery.

She says that the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 500 soles and was used to increase her capital so that she could buy supplies for her bakery. Angélica is now requesting a loan of 1500 soles to buy more ingredients and supplies for making bread such as sugar, butter, yeast, firewood, etc. Her dream for the future is to expand her bakery. What she enjoys the most about her Communal Bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, yeast, butter, firewood, and flour

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y cuenta con estudios primarios completos. La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 meses atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de cereales.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de cereales de la región como papa, habas, chuño, etc.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener su capital propio.
Lo que màs le gusta de su organización son las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Sra. Celia is a member of the Communal Bank “Manuela de Hoy II”. She lives in the District of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. Celia is 48 years old and a single mother of three children. She has an elementary school education and earns a living buying and selling grain.

Celia has been working with Manuela Ramos for 3 months. Her Communal Bank provided her first loan in the amount of 500 soles, which she used to buy grain. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to purchase grains and dry goods from the region such as potatoes, lima beans, chuño (dehydrated potatoes), etc. Her desire for the future is to acquire her own capital. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains & dry goods

loans.name: Grimaldina Neri

texts.es:
La señora GRIMALDINA NERI E. D. tiene  51 años, vive en el distrito de Huanchaco, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal  FUENTE DE VIDA, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos y se dedica a la preparación y venta de menús.
Con sus primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò arroz, papa, aceite, menestras, fideos, etc. para la preparación de los menús.
Con su próximo crédito de 1,500 nuevos soles comprará  vajillas, cubiertos, arroz, menestras, papas, aceite, fideos, pollos, carnes, etc.  para la preparación de los menús.
Grimaldina sueña con tener una tienda de productos comestibles bien abastecida.
texts.en:
Sra. Grimaldina Neri E. D. is 51 years old and lives in the District of Huanchaco, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Fuente de Vida” (Fountain of Life). Grimaldina completed her high school education and makes her living by preparing and selling food.

With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought rice, potatoes, oil, dried vegetables, noodles, and other ingredients for food preparation. She is now requesting her next loan of 1500 soles to purchase dishes, utensils, rice, dried vegetables, potatoes, oil, noodles, chicken, meat, and other supplies for her business. Grimaldina dreams of opening a store that is well stocked with grocery products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dishes, utensils, and ingredients for her business

loans.name: 25 De Mayo Group

texts.es: Las características principales del grupo “25 D. Mayo” es que sus 16 miembros incluyendo su presidenta la señora Deisy son personas muy dedicadas a su trabajo y a su familia, todos los miembros del grupo tienen sus pequeños negocios D.  venta D. dulces, ventas D. carne D. cerdos, comida, palmito, pan, pollo, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio y al transporte publico D. pajeros y la A.ñilería. La competencia con respecto a sus negocios es alta, ya que todos tienen que trabajar muy duro para poder sacar adelante sus negocios y poder obtener mejores ganancias. El crédito será utilizado para mejorar sus negocios y para ala ampliación D. los mismo con mercadería, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a genera sus ingresos para el sustento D. sus familias. Algunas personas tienen experiencia ya que anteriormente han estado en grupos similares en otras instituciones pero es la primera vez que trabajan con Agrocapital y le dan gracias por la confianza y el apoyo económico que les brinda para mejorar su vida y la D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The main characteristic of the “25 D. Mayo” group is that its 16 members, including their president Deisy, are very dedicated to their jobs and their families. All of the group members have small businesses in areas such as candy sales; meat, pork, food, palm heart, bread, chicken, grocery sales in neighborhood stores; public transport; and bricklaying. The competition with respect to their businesses is high since everyone has to work very hard to be able to get ahead in their businesses and to be able to have better earnings.

The loan will be used to improve their businesses and for the expansion of their businesses through merchandise, food supplies, and tools that help them to generate income to support their families. Some of the group members have experience because they have previously been in similar groups in other institutions. However, it is the first time that they are working with Agrocapital and they are thankful for the confidence and financial support that Agrocapital provides to them to improve their life and that of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mercedes Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora MECEDES CECILIA H. V. tiene  37 años, 2 hijos quienes dependen economicamente de ella, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos y vive en el distrito Huanchaco, de la provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú. 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal  FUENTE DE VIDA y se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos.
El primer crèdito que recibiò fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invertiò en la crianza de pollos bebès.
Con su nuevo crédito de 2,000 nuevos soles comprará 150 pollos bebès para su crianza y posterior comercialización.
Mercedes sueña con tener su granja de pollos.
texts.en:
Mercedes Cecilia H. V. is 37 years old and has two children that are economically dependent upon her. She completed secondary studies and lives in the Huanchaco district, in the Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad in Perú.

Mercedes is a member of the “Fuente de Vida” communal bank, and her business is raising and selling chickens. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which she invested in the raising of baby chicks. With her new loan of 2,000 PEN, she will purchase 150 baby chicks to raise and later sell.

Mercedes dreams of having her poultry farm.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 150 baby chicks

loans.name: Las Muñequitas Dos Group

texts.es: Una D. las características más importantes del Grupo “Las Muñequitas Dos” es que su presidenta la señora Carmen que al igual que el resto D. las socias es madre D. familias que buscan el sustento y el bien estar D. sus familias. Entre las actividades que realizan son las socias esta la venta D. comida, venta D. pan, venta D. ropa y al servicio en moto Taxis. La competencia respeto a sus negocios es fuerte ya que las señoras tienen que competir con otros negocios similares ya bien establecidos en áreas comerciales como ser restaurantes y panaderías pero ese las motiva a trabajar mas para poder llegar a ser personas D. éxito. El crédito será utilizaran para mejorar mas sus negocios y poder dar una mejor atención a su clientela con los arreglos y ampliaciones y con la adquisición D. nueva mercadería D. mejor calidad.  Tiene experiencia ya que la gran mayoría D. las socias trabajaron en Instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital y conocen la forma D. trabajo.
texts.en:
One of the most important characteristics of the "Las Muñequitas Dos" group is that their president, Carmen, just like the rest of the members, is a mother who is seeking sustenance and well being for her family. Among the activities that the members carry out are selling food, selling bread, selling clothes, and motorbike taxi service. The competition for these businesses is strong because the women have to compete with other similar businesses that are already well established in commercial sectors such as restaurants and bakeries, this motivates them to work harder in order to become successful. The loan will be used to further improve their businesses and to give better attention to their customers in the form of repairs and upgrades and to buy new merchandise of better quality. The great majority of the members worked in similar institutions at the Fundación Agrocapital and understand this type of work.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris E. es una mujer carismática y luchadora, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, región D. Ucayali, Ella tiene 44 años, es madre D. cuatro hijos(dos mayores D. edad), cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien es profesor y se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir que realiza desD. su casa.
Ella forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres perseverantes II” desD. hace ocho meses; el primer préstamo que recibió fue D. 500.00 nuevos soles que le permitió invertir en polos para damas y caballeros. 
En la actualidad ella necesita un préstamo D. 1000.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra D. calzado para damas, ya que quiere hacer crecer su negocio teniendo una variedad D. productos. 
La meta D. Doris es  tener una tienda bien implementada D. artículos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Doris E. is a charismatic woman and a go-getter who lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is 44 years old and is the mother of 4 children (2 of whom are adults.) She has the support of her husband who is a teacher. She has a business selling clothing that she runs from her house. She has been a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Perseverantes II," for 8 months; the first loan that she received was for 500 nuevos soles that allowed her to invest in polo shirts for women and men. Currently she needs a loan of 1000 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy shoes for women, since she want to make her business grow by having a variety of products. Doris' goal is to have a well-stocked store selling items for the home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shoes for women

loans.name: Berta Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora BERTA ALEJANDRINA V. D. R. tiene 65 años, vive en el distrito D. El Porvenir, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SEMILLITAS CREATIVAS.
Ella  cuenta con estudios primarios completos, refiere que por motivos económicos empezó a trabajar desD. pequeña en el campo; tiene 5 hijos quienes no dependen económicamente D. ella.
BERTA se dedica a  la venta D. arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, fideos, gaseosas, golosinas, etc. en la tienda que tiene en su casa.
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò arroz, azúcar, papas, menestras, leche, gaseosas, cerveza, golosinas, etc. para abastecer su tienda.
Actualmente con su próximo crèdito D. 1,800.00 nuevos soles comprará cajas D. gaseosas y cerveza al por mayor, arroz, azúcar , aceite, papas, menestras, fideos, golosinas, etc.  para abastecer sus tienda y así poder tenerla bien surtida.
Ella sueña con ampliar su tienda y tener un bar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Berta Alejandrina V. D. Rodriguez is 65 and lives in the El Porvenir district of Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the Community Bank Semillitas Creativas [Creative Little Seeds]. She studied through primary school, but relates that for economic reasons she began to work in the fields from a young age. She has 5 children, who do not depend on her financially. Berta works selling rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, noodles, soft drinks and candies in the store that she runs from her home. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles, she bought rice, sugar, potatoes, beans, noodles, candies and other items. Now, with her next loan of 1800 Peruvian soles she will buy wholesale cases of soft drinks and beer, rice, sugar, cooking oils, potatoes, beans, noodles, candies and more to proviD. for her store and have it well-stocked. Her dream is to expand her store and have a bar.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy wholesale cases of soft drinks and beer, rice, sugar, cooking oils, potatoes, beans, noodles, candies, etc.

loans.name: Raises Group

texts.es: La principal características del grupo “Raíces” es que sus 12 miembros incluyendo a su presidenta la señora Gisela radican en el mismo barrio, la mayoría de las socias tienen su negocio y otras van con la ilusión de empezar uno nuevo como  la venta de cosméticos y bisutería, venta y compra de movilidades, servicio de transporte público, atención en salón de belleza, venta de comida y otros son empleados de diferentes empresas. Dentro del ámbito de la competencia es alta especialmente en la venta de comida y en la venta de cosméticos, ya que cada socia espera cada día un buen resultado en sus ventas, existe una gran competencia ya que las socias pudiendo estar ubicadas en un puesto o en algún lugar esperando que sus clientes vengan a ellos, al contrario, ellos salen a ofrecer sus cosas ambulando para así poder tener una buena venta durante su día.
