El destino del crédito es hacer crecer su negocio con el incremento de mercadería a bajo costo, adquisición de herramientas e insumos para incrementar sus ingresos y poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor educación y una mejor calidad de vida. La mayoría de las socias solo habían escuchado de los créditos solidarios, pero en la capacitación que se les da en el transcurso de crédito, se les informo como era el movimiento y como era lo que desea esta institución para los socios, pero algunas socias ya estaban muy bien informadas de esto, ya que anteriormente habían estado en otra instituciones similares a la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The principal characteristic of the Raíces group is that the 12 members, including the president, Gisela, are from the same neighborhood. Most of the members have businesses. Others have the dream of starting a new one like selling cosmetics and jewelry, buying and selling vehicles, public transportation service, beauty salon, and selling food. Others are employed by different businesses. The competition is high, especially in food sales and the sale of cosmetics. Each day every member hopes for a good result in their sales. There is much competition, and the members could stay in a stand or in one place waiting for the customers to come to them. To the contrary, the members travel to sell their things in order to be able to have good sales during the day. The loan is to make their businesses grow with the increase of merchandise at a low cost. It is also to get tools and supplies to increase income. This is to give their children a better education and a better quality of life. Most of the members had only heard of group loans. In the training that they were given about loans they were informed about the movement. They learned what this institution wants for the members. Some members were already well informed about this because they had been in other similar institutions with the Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora JUANA C. C. D. O. tiene  62 años, vive en el distrito D. Huanchaco, D. la provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal FUENTE D. VIDA, presenta estudios secunadrios completos y tiene 4 hijos quienes la apoyan eventualmente. 
La socia se dedica  a la compra y alquiler D. carros para taxi y con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò piezas y repuestos para darle mantenimientos a los 2 autos que tenìa.
Con su próximo crédito D. 1,000 nuevos soles comprará también repuestos para darle mantenimiento a los 3 autos que ahora tiene.
Juana sueña con aumentar su flota D. carros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana C. C. D. O. is 62 years old and lives in the Huanchac district of Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the Community Bank Fuente D. Vida [Fountain of Life]. She has a high school education and has 4 children who help support her from time to time. She works in the sale and rental of cars for use as taxis, and with her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles she bought spare parts in order to maintain the 2 cars that she had. With her next loan of 1000 Peruvian soles she will again buy parts to keep up the 3 cars that she now owns. Juana's dream is to expand her fleet of cars.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy spare parts for her cars

loans.name: Mayubel

texts.en:
Mayubel is 45 years old. She is married to Freddy Chavarría Guillén. Mayubel sells clothing door-to-door in her neighbourhood. Freddy works in construction. The couple lives with their 3 sons in Turrialba, a rural region in the central valley of Costa Rica. Her full-time job is a domestic worker in a household of 3 grown men and one child. Despite the heavy workload of cooking and cleaning for her sons and husband, she is determined to contribute to the family’s income. This is why she dedicates at least 3 days a week, between domestic jobs and when her youngest son is in school, to her clothing business. 

Since 2006, Mayubel has successfully paid back, on time and in full, consecutive loans in the amounts of 100,000, 200,000 and 300,000 colones. Mayubel is now applying for a loan of 500,000 colones that she will use to buy more items for her inventory in bulk show she can bet better prices from her suppliers. She is happy to be applying for a larger amount than she has in the past. Mayubel wants to purchase a new sewing machine so she can make her own clothes to sell. At the moment, she has one machine, but it is very old and doesn’t work very well. 

Mayubel opened her business in 2006 with 100,000 colones. Before her business, she had a domestic worker job that required her to travel from Turrialba to Tres Rios (a 90-minute bus ride each way) every day. She worked for 7 years in a house as a domestic worker and was paid 6000 colones per day, which is the same amount she now earns by selling 2 shirts. 

Having only completed primary school, Mayubel has few options for employment. Domestic work did not pay well and the job left her exhausted. She started her business as an alternative to domestic work. Now, she says she enjoys her work, and takes pride in being able to make a more significant contribution to family income. In a good month, she can earn 300,000 colones and in a bad month, she still earns 200,000 colones. 

Mayubel tailors her business to a range of clients by offering a variety of clothing, for men, women and children. Her sister-in-law makes underwear, which Mayubel can purchase at a good price. The rest of her inventory comes from San Jose, the capital of Costa Rica. 

Mayubel is proud to report that her youngest son is very intelligent. She wants to save enough money to enable him to attend university. Her other two sons never finished high school and now work with their father in construction.

The field consultant who has worked with Mayubel since 2006 describes her as very shy and insecure. Having loans in her name and handling money has made her visibly more confident in making decisions. Rural areas, such as Turrialba, are characterized by many difficulties such as a lack of job opportunities, infrastructural deficiencies, low levels of formal education and lack of available financial services. By lending to Mayubel, you are making a direct investment in the improvement of the life of her and her family, enabling them to help themselves.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia FELIPA es una madre de familia, tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene una hija. Roas Maria del Pilar estudia en el colegio en el primer grado de secundaria. Ellas viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de venta de leche a domicilio. Ella compra leche de la ciudad de Estantillo que esta cerca de la fortaleza de Sacsayhuman.  Ya son diez años con el negocio le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más litros de leche y después venderlo casa por casa.    
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Felipa, aged 37, lives in a common law marriage and is the mother of a daughter, Roas María del Pilar, who attends the first grade of secondary school. They live in Cusco, the historic capital of the Inca Empire. Felipa is a member of the communal bank "Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastián" (Our Lady of the Rosary of Saint Sebastian) of the microfinance institution Asociación Arariwa.

Our member combines her tasks as a housewife and a milk seller from her home. She buys milk in the city of Estantillo, located near the walled complex of Sacsayhuamán. She has been in business for ten years already and has done very well, thanks to all the effort she put into her work. Felipa is a hard-working and entrepreneurial mother who supports her family. She applies for the loan to buy additional milk which she will sell from house to house.

Our member is grateful for the opportunity she gets with this loan and likewise is committed to repay it according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital and buy additional milk

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosalía es socia del banco comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao. Ella tiene 43 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 9 hijos (7 D. ellos viven con ella y 2 ya tienen su familia)y estudiò hasta  tercero D. primaria.
Rosalía trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años; se dedica a la compra y venta D. verduras los días viernes y domingos, y paralelamente compra y venD. animales como : vaca ,ovejas y otros.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró 2 ovejas, 2 chanchitos y que luego los vendió.
Ella solicitarà un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles los que invertirá la mitad en animales y la otra mitad en su negocio D. verduras.
Su visión hacia el futuro es ser mayorista en su negocio y repartir sus productos, y a su vez dejar a sus hijos bien establecidos.
Lo que màs le gusta D. su banco comunal es asistir a las reuniones y charlas que dan las promotoras y aprender a ser puntual.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a member of the Community Bank “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” from the district of Pilcuyo, in El Collao province, Peru. She is 43 years old, is married, and has 9 children. Seven of the children live with her and two have their own families. She studied up to third graD. in elementary school. Rosalia has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for 4 years. She works buying and selling vegetables on Fridays and Sundays, and also works buying and selling animals such as cows, sheep, and others. She tells us that with her first loan, which was for 300 Peruvian soles, she bought 2 sheep and 2 pigs that she later sold. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Peruvian soles. She will invest half in animals and half in her vegetable business. He vision for the future is to work as a wholesaler in her business and to distribute her products. She would also like to see her children well established on their own. What she likes the most about her community bank is going to the meetings and talks that are given by the organizers, and learning to be on time.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs, sheep, etc.

loans.name: Alex Natividad

texts.es:
Alex tiene 25 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo de tres años. Vive junto a su familia en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el sector Cassinelli, en el caserío Muy Finca, distrito de Mochumí, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace cinco años se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales domésticos. El empezó su negocio gracias a los ahorros que guardó mientras trabajaba como jornalero en los campos agrícolas cercanos. Usualmente cría cerdos para comercializar su carne entre sus vecinos y aves de corral para vendérselas a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona.

Con las ganancias de esta actividad ha logrado reunir dinero para arrendar una hectárea de terreno agrícola donde piensa instalar cultivo de arroz. Los gastos de mantenimiento de este cultivo son elevados por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de semilla.

Alex sueña con tener su propia casa donde pueda vivir con su joven familia, además desea instalar en ella una bodega. En la fotografía nos muestra un grupo de pavos listos para ser comercializados.
texts.en:
Alex is 25 years old, married, and has a son who is 3 years old. They live together with his family in his parents' house, located in the Cassinelli area in the Muy Finca village, in the Mochumi district, which is 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For 5 years he has worked raising and selling domestic animals. He started this business thanks to the savings that he accumulated while he worked as a day-worker in the nearby farms. Usually he raises pigs to sell their meat to neighbors and poultry to sell to the dealers who frequent the area. With the earnings from this activity he has managed to collect enough money to lease a hectare of agricultural land where he plans to grow rice. The expenses of cultivating this land are high and for this reason he has seen the necessity of requesting for the first time a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of seeds. Alex dreams of having his own house where he could live with his young family. In addition, he would like to set up a small store in the house. In the photograph, we show a group of turkeys ready to be sold.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice seed to plant crops

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita es socia del banco comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia de El Collao. Ella tiene 44 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5  hijos( uno de ellos vive con ella y los otros 4 son independientesy trabajan en Tacna) Y cuenta con estudios hasta segundo año de primaria.
Margarita trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años; se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, chancho, oveja. 
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compró ovejas.
Ella solicitarà un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en la compra de 1 moto.
Su visión hacia el futuro es mejorar su negocio.
Lo que màs le gusta de su banco comunal es el préstamo, ya que se los dan con muchas facilidades.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” communal bank in the Pilcuyo district of the El Collao province. She is 44 years old, married and has 5 children (one of whom lives with her and the other 4 are independent and work in Tacna). She has completed her studies through the second year of primary school. Margarita has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 years; she works in the business of buying and selling of cattle, pigs and sheep. She tells us that she bought sheep with her first loan of S/ 300.00 nuevos soles. She is requesting a loan of S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, which she will invest in the purchase of a motor scooter. Her future vision is to improve her business. What she likes most about her communal bank is the loan process, because they provide reasonable payment terms.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor scooter

loans.name: 8 De Septiembe Group

texts.es: El Grupo  “8 D. Septiembre” esta representado por la señora María Eliane y conformado por 16 miembros que van ingresando a un segundo ciclo demostrando unidad como grupo y responsabilidad con sus obligaciones. Cada socia cuenta con sus actividades económicas en sus propios hogares, ellas se caracterizan por ser cumplidas y dedicadas tanto con su familia como con su negocio ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus hijos, las socias se dedican a la venta D. abarrote en tiendas D. barrio, también venden horneado, algunas D. dedican a la venta D. cosméticos y productos yanbal D. perfumes los cuales son negocios ambulantes. La competencia D. las socias es alta ya que la demanda en compra D. cosméticos no es muy alta por lo que piensan montar un negocio nuevo que genere mayores ganancias, Es por este motivo que requieren del financiamiento para capital D. trabajo, compra D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que coadyuven a generar mayores ingresos para mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The group "8 D. Septiembre" is represented by María Eliane and is maD. up of 16 members that are entering a second cycle demonstrating unity as a group and responsibility with their payments. Each member has their own economic activities in their own homes. They are noted for their punctuality and their dedication both to their family and their business which is the means of support for their children. The women sell groceries in neighborhood stores as well as baked goods. Some sell cosmetics and Yanbal perfume products which are traveling businesses. The competence of these women is high, though the demand for cosmetics is not very high. It is because of this that they are thinking of starting up a new business to generate more income. It is for this reason that they require financing for business capital, consumables, and tools to help generate more income to better the quality of life of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operation Capital

loans.name: Santos Roberto

texts.es:
el señor Santos Roberto L. tiene 39 años de edad, vive en union libre con la señora Nelly Maribel Avila quien labora en la empacadora de camaron Ibermar en el puesto de supervisora. 
Mutuamente contribuyen con los gastos de la familia, tienen 2 hijos pequeños.
 Santos se dedica a vender agua en su carro en diferentes mercaditos, pulperias y negocios de San Lorenzo.
Santos esta solicitando el crédito con el cual quiere mejorar el estado de su vehiculo le quiere
comprar las llantas y lo demas del dinero invertirlo siempre en el negocio.
el carro es el alma de su negocio ya que sin el no podria repartir el agua.
texts.en:
Santos Roberto L., 39, lives with his life partner, Nelly Maribel Avila, who works as a supervisor at the Ibermar shrimp packing company. Together they contribute to meeting household expenses; they have two small children. Santos sells drinking water from his car to various little grocery stores, markets and other businesses in San Lorenzo. He is requesting financing to improve the state of his vehicle; he wants to buy tires. The rest of the funding he will invest in his inventory. The car, however, is the soul of his business because, without it, delivering water would be impossible.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small and large bottles of water, bags of water, vehicle tires.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Norma es socia del banco comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo , provincia de El Collao. Ella tiene 31 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen de ella y cuenta con estudios secunadrios completos.
Norma trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años; se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y además a la venta de queso, chuño, papa, etc.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró animales: chanchos y ovejas.
Ella solicitarà un préstamo de S/.500.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en un viaje a Arequipa en donde venderá chuño,papas y otros.
Su visión hacia el futuro es mejorar su calidad de vida y progresar cada vez más.
Lo que màs le gusta de su banco comunal son las reuniones, las charla y el préstamo que la salvò de algunos apuros.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” communal bank in the Pilcuyo district of the El Collao province. She is a 31-year-old married woman, has 3 children who depend on her and has completed her secondary school studies. Norma has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 4 years; she works in the business of buying and selling cattle as well as cheese, "chuño" (a type of dried potato), potatoes, etc. She tells us that she bought animals--pigs and sheep--with her first loan of S/ 300.00 nuevos soles. She is requesting a loan of S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, which she will invest in a trip to Arequipa where she will sell chuño and potatoes among other things. Her future goal is to improve her quality of life and make even more progress. What she likes most about her communal bank are the meetings, chats and the loan that got her out of a tight spot.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: chuño, potatos, cheese

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Nuestra socia MARISOL, es soltera y tiene 25 años de edad. Ella vive en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia trabaja en el Seguro Social de Salud (ESSALUD) como enfermera y también tiene una joyería en el centro comercial “El Triunfo” en la Plaza de Armas del Cusco donde vende pulseras, collares y aretes de plata. La socia, su novio y su suegra ya son varios años que tienen el negocio y les ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante su profesión. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar una vitrina de vidrio para exponer sus productos a los turistas que llegan a la ciudad del Cusco.     
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
MARISOL, 25, is single and lives in the imperial city of Cusco. She is a member Asociación Arariwa's “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN” communal bank. She works as a nurse in the Social Security Health Center (ESSALUD). She also has a jewelry store in the "El Triunfo" shopping center in Cusco's main square where she sells silver bracelets, necklaces and earrings. She and her boy friend and mother-in-law have had this business for several years now and they do very well thanks to the efforts they put into their work. She is a hard-working, enterprising young woman who is making headway in her profession. She needs funding to buy a glass display case to show her wares to the tourist trade that visits Cusco. She is grateful for the opportunity granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a display case.

loans.name: Nori Janet

texts.es:
Nori Janet es una socia trabajadora y dinámica, vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 36 años, es viuda y madre de tres hijos menores de edad.
Nori se dedica a la compra y venta de madera (listones, tablas, tucos) y forma parte del Banco Comunal “Del Futuro” desde hace siete años.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que invirtió en la compra y venta de  productos de belleza. 
En la actualidad Nori necesita un crédito de 1000.00 soles que serán utilizados para comprar madera Capirona en el puerto de la cidad de Pucallpa para posteriormente venderla a sus clientes. 
La meta de Nori es aumentar su producción de madera y tener una tienda de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Nori Janet is a hardworking and dynamic member who lives in the Yarinacocha district of the Ucayali region. She is a 36-year-old widow and the mother of three minor children. Nori works in the business of buying and selling wood (strips, boards and planks) and she has been a part of the "Del Futuro" Communal Bank for seven years. She invested her first loan of 300.00 nuevos soles in the purchase and sale of beauty products. Currently, Nori needs a loan of 1000.00 soles, which will be used to buy Capirona wood in the port of Pucallpa in order to later sell it to her customers. Nori's goal is to increase her wood production and have a clothing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to buy Capirona wood in the port of Pucallpa.

loans.name: Jose Saul

texts.es:
el señor Jose Saul M. tiene 53 años de edad, vive en union libre con la señora Brenda Barahona,  tienen 2 hijos. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de golosinas y Jose al negocio de 
compra y venta de agua, tiene 4 años de realizar esta actividad.
 
sus ventas son diarias, hace cuatro viajes diarios al dia
 
esta solicitando el credito para arreglar su vehiculo, cambio de repuestos y tambien hacer afinamiento, tambien comprara mas botellones de agua.

el se siente muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien.
su sueño es graduar a sus hijos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Jose Saul M., 53, lives with his life partner, Brenda Barahona; they have two sons. His wife sells sweets and Jose sells drinking water. He has been in this line of work for 4 years. His sales are daily and he makes four sales runs each day. He requests funds to repair his vehicle. It needs some parts replaced and a tune-up. He will also buy more large bottles of water. He is very happy that things are turning out well. His dream is to see his sons become university graduates.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy water in bags and large bottles.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariela Esperanza

texts.es:
Mariela Esperanza es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 38 años, es madre de 4 hijos de los cuales uno es mayor de edad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es soldador y se dedica a la venta de comida regional. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa y trabaja conjuntamente con sus hijos.
Mariela forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Divinas” desde hace un año; el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que invirtió en pollos, para luego venderlos en el mercado Bellavista de la ciudad de Pucallpa. 
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles que utilizará en la compra de pollos para luego ser vendidos.La meta de Mariela es tener un local propio para su restaurant.
texts.en:
Mariela Esperanza is a dynamic and collaborative member who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is a 38-year-old mother of 4 children, one of whom is an adult. She relies on the support of her husband, who is a welder, and she works in the business of selling regional foods. Her business is located in her home and she works together with her children. Mariela has been a part of the "Las Divinas" Communal Bank for a year; she invested her first loan of 300.00 nuevos soles in chickens in order to later sell them at the Bellavista market in Pucallpa. Now she needs a loan of 800.00 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy chickens for sale. Mariela's goal is to have a site specifically for her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to buy chickens to sell at the Bellavista market in Pucallpa.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Tania es una mujer perseverante que vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 36 años, es madre de tres hijos menores de edad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que es soldador y se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches, que funciona en su casa.
Tania forma parte D. Banco Comunal “D. Futuro” desde hace un año. 
El primer préstamo que recibó fue de 300.00 nuevos soles, que invirtió en insumos para preparar comidas. 
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1200.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de sillas, carpa y mesas para ampliar su negocio. La meta de Tania es tener una fuente de soda.
texts.en:
Tania is a persevering woman who lives in the Yarinacocha district of the Ucayali region. She is a 36-year-old mother of three minor children. She relies on the support of her husband, who is a welder, and she works in the business of selling food at night out of her own home. Tania has been part of the "D. Futuro" Communal Bank for a year. She invested her first loan of 300.00 nuevos soles in materials for food preparation. Now she needs a loan of 1200.00 nuevos soles, which will be used to buy chairs, a tent and tables to grow her business. Tania's goal is to have a soda fountain.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use her loan to buy chairs, a tent and tables to grow her business.

loans.name: Ylda

texts.es:
La señora Ylda es socia del banco comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao. Ella tiene 37 años D. edad, es casada, tiene 3  hijos, 2 D. ellos viven con ella y uno es independiente y cuenta con estudios secunadrios completos.
Ylda trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años; tiene un laboratorio dental, y paralelamente venD. jugo D. quinua los sábados. 
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, compró ganado: ovejas y chancho.
Ella solicitara un préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, los cuales invertirá en comprar muebles para su laboratorio dental.
Su visión hacia el futuro es tener una casa propia y ampliar su laboratorio dental.
Lo que màs le gusta D. su banco comunal son los bajos interèses, y ademàs nos comenta que aprenden a ser puntuales y a compartir entre socias.
texts.en:
Mrs Ylda is a partner of the “Las Brisaa del Rio Blanco” community bank in the Pilcuyo district of the El Collao provence. She is 37 years old, married and has four children. Two of her children live with her and one is independent with her secondary education are completed. Ylda has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for four years. She has a dental laboratory and also sells quinua grain juice on Saturdays. She told us her fist loan was for S/300 Peruvian nuevo soles with which she bought livestock: sheep and pigs. She is requesting a loan S/3,000 Peruvian nuevo soles for the purchase of fixtures for her dental laboratory. Her vision of the future is to have her own house and expand her dental laboratory. What she likes most about her community bank, are the low interest rates in addition to the skills she learns of being punctual and sharing with among associates.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dental office fixtures/furniture.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
la señora Justina B. N. tiene 44 años de edad, vive en la colonia Nueva Caucara, tiene 15 años de vivir en ese lugar. es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos,  los dos dependen de ella a un 100%. 
 
la señora N. tiene un pèqueño negocio de pulperia en su casa de habitacion, esto hace que no descuide a sus hijos ni su negocio. en la pulperia vende productos como ser jabon, pollo, manteca, arroz y todo lo relacionado con la canasta basica familiar
 
este negocio lo tiene desde hace 05 años, gracias al mismo a podido sacar adelante a sus dos hijos esta solicitando el credito para surtir su negocio en esta navidad en donde las ventas incrementan y la demanda es mayor.
quiere comprar varios pollos porque muchas personas hacen pollos rellenos en la cena de navidad.
texts.en:
Justina B. N., 44, has lived in Nueva Caucara neighborhood for 15 years. She is a single mother of two sons, both of whom are 100% dependent on her. Mrs. N. has a small grocery store that she runs from her home. This permits her to neglect neither her children nor her store. She sells such items as: soap, chicken, lard, rice, and everything related to basic household needs. She has been in this line of work for 5 years and, thanks to her business, she has been able to see her two sons get ahead in life. She is requesting funding to stock her store during this Christmas season which is when sales increase and demand is greater. She wants to buy several chickens because many families make stuffed chickens for Christmas Eve dinner.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, lard, oil, bread, soft-drinks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elma

texts.es:
Elma M. es una mujer activa y muy colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 41 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos (mayores de edad) y se dedica a la venta de joyas y ropa de segundo uso. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Del Futuro” desde hace dos años y el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles que le permitieron invertir en prendas interiores de damas para luego ser vendidas. 
Ahora Elma necesita un crédito de 1000.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados para comprar joyas y ropas de segundo uso. 
La meta de Elma es tener una tienda de ropas de segundo uso en su casa.
texts.en:
Elma M., 41, is an active and cooperative woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She's a single mother of two adult children. She sells jewelry and second-hand clothing. She has been a member of the "Del Futuro" communal bank for the last two years and her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy ladies underwear to sell. Now, Elma needs 1000 new soles to buy jewelry and second-hand clothing. Elma's goal is to have a used clothing store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry and second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Fiorella

texts.es:
Fiorella Vásquez es una mujer dinámica y optimista que vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 21 años, jòven soltera que vive con sus padres, se dedica a la venta de golosinas; actividad que realiza desde su casa. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Fray Martin de Porres” desde hace dos años y el primer crédito que recibió fue 300.00 nuevos soles que invirtió en la compra de golosinas. 
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 900.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados para la compra plátanos y y la preparaciòn chifles;asì mismo comprará golosinas para su negocio. La meta de fiorella es tener una bodega bien surtida y seguir apoyando a sus padres con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Fiorella Vásquez, 21, is a dynamic, optimistic woman that lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is single and lives with her parents. She sells sweets from her home. She has been a member of the “Fray Martin de Porres” communal bank for the past two years. Her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy sweets. Now, she needs 900 new soles to buy bananas to make chifles (fried plantain chips); she will also buy sweets for her business. Fiorella's goal is to have a well-stocked store and to continue to help her parents meet household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bananas and make chifles (fried banana chips); also to buy sweets for her store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther S. es una mujer carismática y perseverante que vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali Ella tiene 38 años, es madre de dos hijos (uno es mayor de edad) y se dedica a la venta de jugo de caña; paralelamente todos los sàbados y domingos vende parrilladas en las afueras de su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Fray Martin de Porres” desde hace cuatro años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles los que le permitieron invertir en golosinas. 
Ahora Esther necesita un crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles que serán utilizados para la compra de mesas, sillas y vasos para implementar su negocio. 
La meta de Esther es llegar a tener una tienda de prendas de vestir y calzados.
texts.en:
Esther S., 38, is a charismatic, persevering woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali region. She is the mother of two children (one is an adult). She sells sugar cane juice and on weekends she sells grilled meats outside her house. She has been a member of the “Fray Martin de Porres” communal bank for the past four years. Her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy snacks. Now, Esther needs 800 new soles to buy tables, chairs and drinking glasses to equip her business. Her goal is to have a clothing and footwear store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and drinking glasses.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo, cuenta con estudios secundarios  y se dedica a la compra y venta de animales.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos recientemente, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de animales.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener más capital y mas préstamos para mejorar su negocio.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Lidia, 29, is a member of the "Manuelas de Hoy II" communal bank. She lives in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is a single mother of one son. She finished secondary school and she is a small farm animal merchant. She associated with the Manuela Ramos Movement recently and her first, 500 new sol, loan from her communal bank was used to buy animals. Her wish for the future is to have more capital and more loans to improve her business. What she likes best about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
La señora Petrona es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, no cuenta con estudios y se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de cereales.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1500.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà cereales de la región como: chuño, papa, cebada, etc.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener su casa en Tacna y así poder vivir feliz con su familia.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Petrona, 43, is a member of the “Manuelas de Hoy II” communal bank. She lives in Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is a single mother of two children. She has never gone to school and she is a grains merchant. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years now and her first, 300 new sol, loan from her communal bank was used to buy cereals. She now needs 1500 new soles to buy regional cereals like: chuño (freeze-dried potato), potato, barley, etc. Her wish for the future is to have a house in Tacna in which to live happily with her family. What she likes most about her communal bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy freeze-dried potato, potato, barley, etc.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria es socia del banco comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” del distrito de Pilcuyo , provincia de El Collao. Ella tiene 49 años de edad, estudiò hasta tercero de secundaria, es casada y tiene 5 hijos quienes dependen de ella.
Victoria trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años. Se dedica a diversos negocios como: la compra y venta de ropa, compra y venta de ganado y venta de cereales.
Nos cuenta que con su primer préstamo que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró animales: ovejas ,chanchos ,gallinas, etc.
Ella solicitarà un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles los que invertirá en sus tres negocios equitativamente.
Su visión hacia el futuro es ser mayorista en su negocio y comprar una tienda.
Lo que màs le gusta de su banco comunal son las reuniones en las cuales puede aprender a ser mejor comerciante.
texts.en:
Victoria, 49, is a member of the “Las Brisas del Río Blanco” communal bank in Pilcuyo district, El Collao province. She finished 9th grade, is married, and has 5 dependent children. She has cooperated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 4 years now. She is in a variety of lines of work: she sells clothing, farm animals, and cereals. She tells us that her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy animals: sheep, pigs, chickens, etc. She now needs 3000 new soles to invest in her three areas of interest equally. Her vision for the future is to be a wholesaler and to buy a store. What she likes most about her communal bank are the meetings in which she can learn how to be a better merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, sheep, freeze-dried potato, potato, etc.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda es socia del  Banco Comunal “24 de Junio”,vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 36 años de edad , cuenta con estudios primarios concluìdos, es casada, tiene en su poder a un hijo y se dedica a la compra y venta de ovejas.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años atrás y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de ganado ovino.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.3,000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que invertirá en la compra de ovejas.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener una casa en Ilo. Lo que màs le gusta de su organización son las reuniones y el ahorro mensual, porque esto le permite tener un fondo de emergencia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda is a member of the “24th of June” community bank. She lives in the district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao in the area of Puno. She is 36 years old and has her secondary studies completed. She is married and has a son in her charge. She buys and sells sheep for a living. She works with the Manuel Ramos movement for the the last three years and her first community bank loan was for S/300 Peruvian nuevos soles, all of which she invested in the purchase of sheep. She is requesting a loan of S/3,000 Peruvian nuevos soles, which she would invest in the purchase of sheep. Her hope for the future is to have a home in Ilo. What she likes most about the organization are the meetings and the monthly savings because it allows her to have an emergency savings fund.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La señora Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas” desde hace 4 años del distrito y provincia de Puno,departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y no tiene hijos. Nelly cuenta con estudios superiores completos y tiene su carpintería.
Nelly nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital para la compra de madera.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles con los cuales podrá comprar mercadería como: cintas, madera, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener un terreno para poder trabarlo.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las facilidades que le ofrece.
texts.en:
Nelly, 28, has been a member of the "Las Kantutas" communal bank, which is in the district and province of Puno, Puno department, for the past 4 years. She lives with her life partner and has no children. She finished higher education and has a carpintery shop. She tells us that her first, 300 new sol, loan from Manuela Ramos Movement was used to buy lumber. Now, Nelly needs 800 new soles to buy supplies like: saw blades, lumber, etc. Her dream for the future is to have a plot of land to farm. What she most likes about her communal bank are the easy terms it offers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber and saw blades.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo” desde hace 10 años, del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, cuenta con estudios secundarios incompletos y se dedica a compra y venta de ropa.
Elsa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 2500.00 con el cual podrá comprar más mercadería de ropa.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su propio capital.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Señora Elsa has been a member of the Banco Comunal "3 de Mayo" (May 3 Community Bank) for 10 years in the Llave district in El Collao province in the department of Puno. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children. She did not finish high school and she buys and sells clothing. Señora Elsa says that her first loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles from Movimiento Manuela Ramos allowed her to increase her capital. She is now asking for a S/. 2500.00 loan, which she will use to buy more clothing. Her dream for the future is to raise her own capital. The things Señora Elsa likes most about her Banco Comunal are the savings and the meetings with other members.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
La señora Fortunata es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas” desde hace 8 años del distrito y provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 56 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y cuenta con estudios primarios completos.
Fortunata tiene su tieda de abarrotes y nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo incrementar su capital para poder comprar arroz, azúcar y fideos.
Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar mercadería como: azúcar, arroz, fideos, huevos.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa en Moquegua.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fortunate has been a member of the communal bank "Las Kantutas" in the district, province, and department of Puno for 8 years. She is 56 years old, is married, has 3 children, and has complete elementary school education. Fortunata has her own grocery store and she tells us that she used her first loan of PEN 300 with "Manuela Ramos" to purchase rice, sugar, and noodles.
She is now asking for a PEN 600 loan through which she will be able to buy other goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, and eggs for her store.
Her dream is to own a house in Moquegua in the future.
What she enjoys best about her communal bank are the savings and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and noodles

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Nuestra socia BERTHA, tiene 38 años, es madre y padre para sus tres hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “DURABANK” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su hija Jackeline tiene 18 años y estudia en la universidad. José tiene 16 años y Bertha tiene 9 años, ellos estudian en el colegio. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. 

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su lavandería de carros y buses que esta ubicado en su domicilio. La socia cuenta que el negocio lo empezó un amigo pero después de un buen tiempo él se fue a la ciudad de Quillabamba dejándole el negocio. La socia decidió continuar con el negocio. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para implementar un salón de espera en la casa donde los clientes puedan descansar mientras sus carros se están lavando. La socia específicamente desea comprar sillas y mesas.        
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
BERTHA, 38, is both mother and father to her three children. She is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "DURABANK" communal bank. Her daughter Jackeline is 18 and a university student; José is 16 and Bertha is 9; both of them are enrolled in school. They all live in the imperial city of Cusco. She alternates her domestic chores with tending to her car- and bus-washing service located in her home. She tells us that she began the business with a friend but, after a while, he moved to the city of Chillabamba, leaving her the business. She decided to continue with it. She is a hard-working, enterprising woman who struggles to get her family ahead in life. She needs financing to equip a waiting room where customers can rest while their vehicles are being washed. Specifically, she wants to buy tables and chairs. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To equip a waiting room.

loans.name: Baltazara

texts.es:
La señora BALTAZARA R. R. D. Z. tiene 39 años, cuenta con estudios secundarios completos, es casada, tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen econòmicamente D. ella y vive en el distrito D. EL PORVENIR, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. 
Pertenece al Banco Comunal LIDERESAS EN ACCIÒN.   
Baltazara se dedica a  la  compra y venta D. ropa y con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprò ropa  para caballeros, damas y niños.
Con su próximo crédito D. 800.00 nuevos soles viajarà a Lima y comprarà pantalones, jeans, polos, blusas, camisas, shorts, etc. para cubrir los pedidos que tiene por fiestas D. fin D. año.
Ella sueña con alquilar un stand en un mercado o centro comercial para así vender su mercadería con mayor facilidad y rapidez.
texts.en:
Mrs. Baltazara R. R. D. Z. is 39 years old, completed high school, and is married with three dependent children. She lives in El Porvenir District, Trujillo Province, La Libertad Department, Peru. She ia a member of the "Lideresas En Accion" ("Female Leaders in Action") Village Bank. Baltazara buys and sells clothing for a living. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles, she bought men's, women's and children's clothing. With this loan of 800 Soles, she will travel to Lima to buy pants, jeans, t-shirts, blouses, button-up shirts and shorts to fill all of the orders she has received for end-of-the-year parties. Her dream is to rent a stand at a market or commercial center in order to sell her merchandise more quickly and easily.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants, jeans, t-shirts, blouses, button-up shirts and shorts

loans.name: Agueda Inès

texts.es: La señorita Agueda Inès X. G.  cuenta con 31 años de edad es soltera ella reside en el lugar conocido como Caserìo Xetinimit, de la Aldea Nimasac, municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala C.A. en la actualidad se dedica en la elaboración de cortes típicos teniendo su pequeño taller propio  donde semanalmente cumple con sus clientes la demanda de la misma por lo que se acerco a las oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR  por un préstamo,  debido a  que necesita implementar su capital de trabajo comprando y obteniendo mejores oportunidades mejorando aun más su trabajo e ingresos mensuales cubriendo así sus necesidades, y ayudando a su familia
texts.en:
Ms. Agueda Inès X. G. is 31 years old. She is single and lives in a place called Caserìo Xetinimit, in the town of Nimasac, city and State of Totonicapán, Guatemala Central America. Currently she does fine weavings, having her own small workshop where weekly she finishes her clients' orders. She is coming to the ASDIR Association offices for a loan, since she needs working capital (money) to buy and create better opportunities improving her work and monthly earnings covering her necessities, and helping her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (Purchase or raw materials)

loans.name: Maria Neidi

texts.es:
La señora MARIA NEIDI A. M. tiene 42 años, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 1 depende de ella, vive en el distrito de EL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú y cuenta con estudios hasta 5to. de primaria.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal LIDERESAS EN ACCION y se dedica a  la venta de cerveza en su domicilio. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró cajas de cervezas al por mayor.
Con su próximo crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles comprarà cajas de cerveza y gaseosas al por mayor para el abastecimiento de su negocio por fiestas de fin de año. 
Ella sueña con tener una tienda de comestibles en su domicilio y asì generar mayores ingresos en su familia.
texts.en:
MARIA NEIDI A. M., 42, lives with her life partner in the EL PORVENIR district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She finished 5th grade and has 3 children, one of whom is still dependent on her. She is a member of the LIDERESAS EN ACCION communal bank and she sells beer and soft-drinks from her house. Her first, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy cases of beer at wholesale. With her next, 800 new sol, loan she will buy cases of beer and soft-drinks at wholesale to stock her shop for the end-of-year festivities. She hopes to have a grocery store in her home so that she can produce better income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer and soft-drinks at wholesale.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Nuestra socia MARIELA, tiene 22 años, es conviviente y esta embarazada de 8 meses. Ella es natural de la ciudad de Quillabamba. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “DURABANK” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ella vive en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. 

La socia tiene su negocio de transporte de carga pesada que lleva de la ciudad de Quillabamba a la ciudad de Lima. Ya son dos años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento de los carros de transportes y también desea comprar llantas.         
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
MARIELA, 22, lives with her life partner and is 8-months pregnant. She is from the city of Quillabamba and is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "DURABANK" communal bank. She lives in the imperial city of Cusco. She has a heavy cargo transportation service which transports form Quillabamba to Lima. She has been in this line of work for 2 years and has done well, thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. She is a young, hard-working, enterprising woman who wishes to see her family get ahead in life. The funds will be used to service the trucks and to buy tires. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To service her trucks and buy tires.

loans.name: Abadia

texts.en:
Abadia is 36 years old and is from Calca, a town north of Cusco, but she has been living in Cusco for the past 18 years. She is married and has three children, the eldest of whom recently graduated from high school and is looking to continue her education.
Abadia is a client of Asociación Arariwa. She is member of a communal bank in Cusco consisting of 13 members. The group is called Maquimanta Purisun (which, in Quechua, means "walking together hand in hand").
Abadia runs a carpentry business with her husband. They produce furniture mainly, which they sell in one of Cusco's main markets. Her business has been doing well and she wants a loan to buy more materials for the production of furniture so that she can grow the business. Abadia appreciates and thanks you for the loan, and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase materials for furniture production

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.en:
Guillermina is a client of Asociación Arariwa and is member of a communal bank consisting of thirteen members in Cusco. The group is called Maquimanta Purisun (which in Quechua means "Walking together hand in hand"). Guillermina is 63 years old and she lives in Cusco. She is the mother of three children and has ten grandchildren.

Guillermina runs an auto parts distribution business which she started ten years ago. It is a family business and many of her family members help her out. She buys auto parts and repair kits in Lima, the capital of Peru, which she then sells in a market in Cusco and also distributes to nearby towns.

Business is slow during this time of year so Guillermina needs only a relatively small loan to be able to buy additional car parts to supply her customers.

Guillermina appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her auto parts business

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
Nuestra socia LISBETH, tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos: Diego tiene 10 años y Emmanuel de 4 años. Ellos son  naturales de la ciudad de Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “DURABANK” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia y su esposo tienen un negocio familiar de reparación de carros. El esposo trabaja haciendo mantenimientos de carros.  Ya son treinta años con el negocio y les ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Nuestros socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que sacan adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más repuestos de carros.         
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
LISBETH, 40, is married and has two sons: Diego, 10 and Emmanuel, 4. They live in the city of Cusco and she is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "DURABANK" communal bank. She and her husband have a family-run car repair shop. Her husband works servicing cars. He has been in this line of work for 30 years and they have done well thanks to all the effort they put into their work. They are hard-working, enterprising people who see that their family gets ahead in life. She needs funding to buy more car replacement parts. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy car replacement parts.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a client of Asociación Arariwa and is a member of a communal bank consisting of thirteen members in Cusco. The group is called Maquimanta Purisun (which in Quechua means "Walking together hand in hand"). Eduardo, originally from the northern Peruvian city of Chiclayo, is 47 years old and lives in Cusco with his common-law wife and three children.

Eduardo runs an auto accessories distribution business which he started fifteen years ago. He buys accessories for cars and trucks in Lima, the capital of Peru, which he then sells throughout the Cusco region. He wants a loan to buy additional inventory to supply his customers and thereby grow his business.

Eduardo appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his auto accessories business

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ROXANA, tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene una hija. Su hija se llama Kiara, tiene 4 años y esta en el jardín. Ellas son naturales de la ciudad de Cusco. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “DURABANK” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con su trabajo como asistente administrativo en el instituto superior “SENATI” del Cusco. Ella también en su tiempo libre vende carteras a pedido del cliente. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más carteras y vender en estas fiestas navideñas.         
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Roxana is 28 years old, married, and has a daughter. Her daughter’s name is Kiara, she is 4 years old and is in preschool. They are natives of Cusco. Roxana belongs to the “Durabank” communal bank at Asociación Arariwa.

She alternates household chores with her job as an administrative assistant at the “Senati” institute in Cusco. In her free time, she also sells purses by customer request. She has already been in the business for several years and it has gone well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her job. Roxana is hardworking and enterprising, helping her family to get ahead. She needs a loan in order to purchase more purses to sell during the holidays.

Roxana is appreciative of the opportunity provided to her and she is also committed to keeping up with the schedule of repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more purses to sell during the holidays

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, a client of Asociación Arariwa, is a member of a communal bank consisting of 13 members in Cusco called Maquimanta Purisun (which in Quechua means "walking together hand in hand"). Betty, originally from Lima, is a 33-year-old single mother who now lives in Cusco with her two children, both of whom are in grade school.

Betty runs an auto accessories distribution business, purchasng accessories for cars (such as hubcaps and other adornments) in Lima, the capital of Peru, which she then sells in Cusco. She is now requesting a loan to buy additional inventory to supply her customers and thereby grow the business. She hopes to increase her income so that she can afford to buy a house. Betty thanks you for the loan and promises to make the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Buy inventory for auto accessories business

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio ABELARDO tiene 32 años, es casado y tiene dos hijos. El es natural de la ciudad de Cusco. El  socio pertenece al banco comunal “DURABANK” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio tiene su taller automotriz donde repara automóviles. El socio cuenta que compra carros malogrados y los refacciona. Después de arreglarlos los vende como nuevos. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como cera y pintura y también auto partes de carros.         
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Abelardo is 32 years old, married, and has two children. He is a native to the city of Cusco. He belongs to the “Durabank” communal bank at the Asociación Arariwa.

He has a car garage where he repairs automobiles. He tells us that he purchases broken down cars and refurbishes them. After fixing them, he sells them like new. He has already worked several years in the business and it has gone well for him, thanks to the effort that he puts into his work. Abelardo is hardworking and enterprising, helping his family to get ahead. He needs a loan to purchase more materials such as wax and paint, as well as car parts.

He is appreciative of the opportunity provided to him and he is also committed to keeping up with the schedule of repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials such as wax, paint, and car parts

loans.name: Meur

texts.en:
Meur L. is 42 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. Since 2002, she has been growing and selling vegetables to sell at the local market to earn approximately US$2 of profit every day. Her husband is a farm guard and makes US$1 per day. This couple has five children, two of whom are construction workers building houses and three are students.

Meur L. would like to take out a loan of US$600 to make a new investment in order to raise her standard of living. She will use this loan to invest in a grocery-stand business.

loans.use: To invest in a grocery stand

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a client of Asociación Arariwa.  She is member of a village bank with 13 members in Cusco.  The group is called Maquimanta Purisun (which means "walking together hand in hand" in Quechua).  Gloria is 50 years old and lives in Cusco.  She has two children, one in grade school and the other is a technician.

Gloria sells umbrellas and walking canes.  She buys her inventory from wholesalers in Lima and then sells them on the Avenida el Sol in Cusco.  The rains have just arrived in Cusco and coincide with the upcoming holiday season.  Gloria wants to take advantage of the increasing stream of visitors to town during this time of year and is therefore looking for a relatively large loan to buy additional inventory for the winter, her peak business season.

Gloria appreciates and is thankful for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: buying umbrellas and waking canes to sell on the street

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
La familia A. están muy agradecidos por su cooperación en el anterior crédito su negocio ha crecido y han tenido muy buenas ventas.
Nueva mente están solicitando un préstamo para poder surtir el negocio ya que desean tener en sus ventas otro tipo de productos como es los lactaos y carnes frías.  Pero no quieren descapitalizar el negocio es por eso que están solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en estos nuevo productos ya que sus clientes se lo están demandando. 
Planean pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio, ya que tiene tres hijos a quines les quieren dar lo mejor. 
Las personas que aparecen en la foto es el señor Guillermo A. y su esposa la señora María Inés Esquivel quines son los que atiende el negocio.
texts.en:
The A. family is very appreciative for your cooperation with the previous loan. Their business has grown and they have had very good sales.

Once again, they are asking for loan to be able to stock their business since they want to have other products in their sales, such as dairy and cold meats. They don’t want to deplete the business, which is why they are requesting this loan to be able to invest in these new products that their customers are demanding from them.

They plan to repay the loan with part of the business earnings since they have three children to whom they want to give the best.

The individuals that appear in the photo are Guillermo A. and his wife, María Inés Esquivel, who attend to the business.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Pablo P. le está haciendo falta los acabados del exterior de la casa.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Don Pablo tiene tres hijos de diferentes edades y a quienes les quiere dar lo mejorar, es por ellos que desea que su casa este total mente terminada. 
Trabaja en una fábrica en el aria de producción elaborando artículos que son para los laboratorios y hospitales, con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito ya que los gastos familiares se encargará su esposa la señora Manuela Aguilar, quien trabaja en una fábrica de obrera.
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo P. needs to complete the finishing of his home’s exterior.

He needs the loan to be able to buy the material and to pay the person who is in charge to doing the project.

Don Pablo has three children of different ages and he wants to give them the best and it is because of them that he wishes that the home be complete.

Don Pablo works in a factory in the production area, making articles that are used for laboratories and hospitals. With his income, he plans to pay the loan since the household expenses are taken care of by his wife, Mrs. Manuela Aguilar, who works in a factory.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish his home’s exterior.

loans.name: Ork

texts.en: Ork A. is a 45-year-old resident of Kompong Tom Province. To earn a living, Ork A. sells a few mold cakes that she produces from her home to her  village neighbours, normally earning about $1.50 a day. She is married to Mao My, 55, a taxi driver, and they have six children, two of whom are married while the rest are single. Two of their children are employed: a daughter is a garment worker and a son works in construction. Ork A. is requesting a loan to buy a used motorcycle for her employed children to commute to work.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es: i hit my knee. it hurts.
texts.en:
i hit my knee. it hurts.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sdf

loans.name: Whee Group

texts.es: just to get just to get by
texts.en:
just to get just to get by

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: dasd

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida T. is from the village of Lagonglong. Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Adelaida is single, with one school-aged child. To make a living, Adelaida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Adelaida has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Adelaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Adelaida is requesting a second loan from HSPFI.  This new loan of 8000 PHP will be used to invest in expanding the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to low-income households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea M., 37 years old, is married and the mother of a teenage child, who attends secondary school. Chea M. and her husband are rice cultivators. In addition to their farm work, this couple sells rattan cupboards that they either weave or buy in bulk from other weavers. Chea M. is seeking a loan to purchase a piece of her neighbor’s farmland. She plans to plant different crops on this land to provide her family with additional income.

loans.use: To purchase additional farmland

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce H. is from the village of Kinogitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Joyce is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Joyce operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from the buying and selling of "longganiza" (a processed ground pork) in the local community. Joyce is just starting this business.

In 2009, Joyce joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joyce is requesting a new loan of 4,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Joyce from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina B. is from the village of  Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Merlina is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Merlina runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Merlina is just starting this business.

In 2009, Merlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlina is requesting a new loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Merlina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena M. is from the village of Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old. Nena is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Nena runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Nena is just starting this business.

In 2009, Nena joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena is requesting a new loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Nena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bech

texts.en: Bech S. was born in 1976 and is married with a young child who is not going to school. Bech S. and her husband own a small business selling rattan furniture. This couple also uses a cow cart to transport their rattan to sell around their community. They take a few days or a week to sell produce. Since selling rattan is the most profitable business, this family would like to depend on it. To make the business more successful and to have more income, Bech S. is applying for a $500 loan to be used to order additional rattan furniture to sell.

loans.use: To order additional rattan furniture to sell

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta E. is from the village of Bonfal Proper, in Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 56 years old. Violeta is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Violeta owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables and other products in the local community. Violeta has owned her general store for over 3 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase more vegetables to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Violeta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Barseliza

texts.en:
Barseliza B. is from the village of Kinoguitan in Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Barseliza is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Barseliza owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (general) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food & daily use products in the local community. Barseliza has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Barseliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Barseliza is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the 1st taken out by Barseliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim C., age 32, is the widowed mother of two school-aged children. She owns a small grocery store, where she sells a variety of foodstuffs to generate an income. Recently, part of her stock has been exhausted; she wants to resupply and is requesting a loan from HKL to purchase a variety of other grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
